Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have said that their rooms were small, I paid for a standard room and it was perfectly adequate. It was overlooking the garbage bins, but by San Francisco standards it was really really quiet. In 30 years of travelling to San Francisco i had my best two nights sleep there,ever. Every member of staff that I had contact with were delightful. I particularly enjoyed tickling Lucy, behind reception ( ok she is a pug dog ) I would stay here again in a heartbeat,loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky,cosy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayne L
Reviews.Content: What a great find!! I was impressed from the moment we entered the lobby. We arrived earlier than anticipated, and they were kind enough to offer an alternate room. However, much to my disappointment it was on the top floor, but overlooking an alley where the rubbish was collected. I rang front desk immediately, and the issue was fixed promptly. They offered to hold our bags while our originally booked room was cleaned, and we left to explore. Upon return, we were shown to a beautiful room overlooking a pebbled courtyard. Each evening between 5pm-6pm, they hosted and provided a 'wine' hour, with a massage available. Mornings, tea coffee, hot chocolate provided in the same location, a nice way to start the day. This hotel is 'pet' friendly, which I personally, as an animal lover, did not find offensive or an issue at all. The rooms were immaculately clean, well maintained, and beautifully furnished. In fact, I heard a bark only once, and visibly sighted 'pet guests' on only 2 occasions. The adjacent restaurant/cafe is a bonus, and the menu/food on offer was delicious. Great ambience, particularly Fri/Sat nights when Jazz entertainment provided. I highly recommend this property, and suggest when booking you join Kimptons 'in touch' programme (free of charge). We were provide a daily New York Times, $10 credit for use of mini bar, and a voucher for use at the hotels spa. Also, a bonus for all travelers, free wi-fi. Don't hesitate, this hotel has it all. Location, character, and a heart, woof!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Summer8204
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 2 nights while in San Fran. We were greeted by wonderful hosts at the hotel, who readily volunteered to hold our luggage as we were early to check in, as well as helped direct us to great restaurants and called a shuttle to the airport upon checkout. Our room was great, yes it is a little small but really, more than enough space for us, our luggage, and to move around comfortably. The room was decorated in a very modern way, with a very large mirror and a canopy over the bed (which was very comfy). The evening hosted wine reception was amazing...they were not stingy on their pours either! (however they post there is cheese available, which I did not see!). The neighborhood is good, it is on the edge of Tenderloin, and as with any urban city there was bums in the area which were annoying but not overly aggressive. Would totally stay here again...it was a tad pricey but the best deal I could find in the Union Square area of San Fran. Also----we saw a cart being pushed to a room for room service that had a fish in a fishbowl on it....I didn't ask any questions, but thought that was pretty cool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mac1419
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with outstanding service. As a Kimpton In Touch member they upgraded me to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for our recent anniversay”
Reviews.Author: CunningMcFar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a Monte Carlo Suite here for our 12th wedding anniversary and could not be happier with our choice. Huge, gorgeous suite, jacuzzi tub, super comfortable bed and furnishings. Friendly and attentive service from all staff during our short stay. Bar serves up quality cocktails and is long on atmosphere, and the French offerings for Sunday brunch were quite satisfying and perfectly decadent --champagne, cocktails, oysters, mussels, escargot, charcuterie and flammekueche at 9am?!? Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lblake87
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while traveling for business for 3 nights. The service was great- all staff that I met were accommodating and friendly. The rooms are decorated to be fun and inviting. I enjoyed the cozy fireplace off the lobby - great for warming up after the chilly outdoor air. I also liked the small but convenient fitness room. Hopefully I'll be back to Hotel Monaco during my next trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service...”
Reviews.Author: 2jjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monaco as part of our honeymoon travels. The hotel is located within close proximity to Union Square where we were easily able to get on a tour bus to see the sights of San Francisco and also to do some shopping. We were given a large room which was very clean. We were made to feel welcome and the staff were extremely helpful and were clued up on what to do and where to go in San Francisco. I am glad we chose to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScreenSydney
Reviews.Content: Great base for 4-5 days. Close to Union Square as well as good local restaurants. Yes, small bedroom reminded us more of London-type accomodation but the lounge, restaurant and bar, together with walking-distance to everything, meant we were barely in the room. Extras such as iced drinks on return from walks and the evening wine tastings (with massage if you chose) were highly welcoming. Our breakfast wasn't included in the tariff but we made sure to start each morning with the great food and service on offer each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: jtmsi
Reviews.Content: Two lifelong friends and I spent a terrific weekend at Hotel Monaco in San Francisco. The staff was uniformly friendly, helpful and interested in our comfort. The room decor is zany (reminds one of a big top in the circus) but comfortable. We loved the location: close to cozy little restaurants and Union Square shopping. As others have mentioned, the wine reception is a great way to transition from daytime activities to evening dinner. The restaurant and bar are excellent if you don't want to venture out in the evening chill, and the wait staff is very accomodating. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, sophisticated hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKseetheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was a great home base location for most things we wanted to do in SF. It is walking distance to tons of shopping and restaurants. The room is on the small side, but average for a city. Otherwise streamlined, modern and clean decor with comfortable bed and full bathroom. We were on the 6th floor and it was super quiet, no external noise from the city, no room to room noise. We self-parked our rental car, which was significantly less expensive than having the hotel valet park it, and we used the same garage (right around the corner) that the hotel uses. Tea and water is regularly available in the lobby throughout the day which was useful. Free wifi available by becoming a remember of their rewards club, also free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Laurence B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, outstanding staff. Made us feel at home right from day 1. the concerige staff, wonderful. Clean, quiet (except for the early morning garbage pick up in the alley), everything a guest would want. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “If able to get a good rate, this can be a good choice”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: My room was very small - fortunately, by myself so it was ok. While the hotel is close to Union Square & Nob HIll, it is also close to the Tenderloin. It is a perfectly safe location - just be aware of directions. The highlight of my stay was the evening wine reception - in addition to drinks & some food, enjoyed chatting with other guests. Service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: darkwaters
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in a Kimpton Hotel and I enjoyed the experience each time. Terrific wine and cheese at night, cozy rooms and pet friendly! Staff are knowledgeable and are happy to help. Provided insight on restaurants and places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: ellyn1135
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique-style hotel near Union Square. Stayed with my 90-year old father and the front desk and bell staff provided wonderful service. The public areas are lovely and it was delightful to see guests with their dogs. Many fun eateries nearby within walking distance. Close to cable cars and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirl5201
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. It was really cute. I was given an upgrade to one of the suites and that was really wonderful, I loved the large jacuzzi, and the soft comfortable couch. I also ate at the Grand Cafe next door and the Mason Cafe around the block and both restaurants were incredible. The location is great, walking distances to the Moscone (about 10 minutes) and tons of nearby shopping, bars, restaurants.... Christine- the front desk manager was very helpful with helping me with my logistics. The entire staff was friendly and polite. I can't wait to continue staying at Kimpton Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - missed the Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Lexie41
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with comfortable but small rooms. Checkin was fast and efficient. Bed was great. Happy hour in the lounge was a good value. The 'other' happy hour with complimentary wine and a few bites was also a plus. What we missed was a Concierge to answer questions. We arrived Wednesday and didn't see one until Saturday morning. No excuse - just she was off for two days. Not sure this is excusable in a four star hotel. We like animals, but not at the front door, behind the counter or in the wine room mingling with guests. Also, if you are looking for a reasonably priced breakfast, please check elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but if you have bad animal allergies this hotel is not for you”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend who was in from out of town after a day of shopping around the union square area. This is a nice hotel, and like all the reviews state, it is in a good central location to all the shopping and theater. The staff is very polite and accommodating. Our valet parking was quick and efficient as was check in and check out. Definitely 5* service. I have stayed at 5* hotels (ie Ritz's, Fairmonts, Four Seasons etc.) where the service has not been this good. If you like older, elaborate, quirky decor, this hotel is for you. The lobby is really pretty, as is the 20's style decor in the attached restaurant. Sadly we missed the wine reception, but we did try the restaurant which was quite good and like the hotel had nice service. As for the homeless people - San Francisco is full of homeless people, but they are harmless. Point is, you are most likely going to get some homeless people around your hotel in SF regardless of where you are staying - ie they hang out around all the 5* hotels too, not just this one. Despite all the great things about this hotel, I will likely not return. This has nothing to do with the hotel, but has to do with the fact that I have bad animal (cat and dog, and anything else with fur) allergies. Like everyone says, this is an extremely pet friendly hotel - as in any sized pet, no size restrictions. There are even pets behind the front desk. I know many hotels in SF are pet friendly, and most allow cats and small dogs, but if you are badly allergic to animals, I would steer clear of this hotel. I think pet owners purposely choose this hotel because it is so pet friendly - ie: there are no size restrictions, they give out doggie treats etc, etc. I am assuming there are a lot more animals in this hotel than there would be at other hotels in SF that have the size restrictions etc. When I booked our stay, I saw the overall positive reviews for this hotel on trip advisor, and just acted too quickly. I didn't read through the hotel's website or the reviews very thoroughly, so I didn't catch the whole pet thing until we'd prepaid and were checking in (my own fault). The staff was accommodating and put us on a pet free floor, but I was still a little bothered - ie woke up a little puffy eyed and congested. Not surprising as there is no way to prevent animal dander and fur from getting into the air and floating around. For me, this hotel was fine for a night, but it wouldn't have been good if we were there for a week. My own fault for not looking at the reviews and hotel website better, so I hope that any one with bad allergies who thinks they might be ok for an extended stay at this hotel reads this review. As a last comment, if you aren't expecting it, you might be surprised at how expensive the hotels and parking are in San Francisco at the end of the summer. ie - our 1 night stay here for a standard room with 2 double beds was well over $400 a night with tax and parking. If possible you may want to travel off season after the flood of European tourists leave the city. Rates in the late fall/winter are much better (and sometimes the weather isn't that much different).

Reviews.Title: “Started off not so great..but it ended well!!”
Reviews.Author: m_17kisses
Reviews.Content: So we checked into this hotel just this last week. Our two full bed room was tiny....and I mean smaller than what the photo on the website shows it as... we were missing a chair and two benches that goes at the end of the beds..because the room was that small. Anyway we were like whatever, but two hours after we checked in my sock got wet when I went into the bathroom. Carpet was soaking wet. Called and told them, someone came up and said Oh it was from previous guest ironing. Okay nice...she brought us slippers to use. Next morning I found that the carpet was even more wet and in the closet and to the first bed. We told front desk and they said to pack our stuff and they will move it later as they were full. When we came back that night our stuff was moved to another room and it was the room showed in the photo, we had two chairs and two benches at the end of the bed. It was a better sized room for 4 people and luggage. After we got into the room no problems and had a great stay! Free wireless internet, make sure to just sign up for their little thing when you connect and its free. Wine hour every night, awesome. Wines for free! and sparkling cider..and some food.....AND free back massages. There was a tv and a wii...a couple kids were playing some sports on it during wine hour. Thought that was cool. Morning, you have free coffee, tea and hot chocolate, it was all good. Jacuzzi was really nice, big too. Pet friendly hotel, so we got to see Oliver (dog) during wine hour..he was great. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy-n-Ron
Reviews.Content: This is our 'go-to' hotel in San Francisco! Stayed there again last week and were just as charmed as our first visit 7 years ago! Warm, friendly staff and very nice happy hour- highly recommend- our dog henri loves it too! (free for doggies!!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: FunnyPaper
Reviews.Content: Not your cookie cutter hotel! First clue - the dog bowls. At the entrance! Yes they allow pets. Check behind the counter - the furry one greets you too! Staff is wonderful, very engaging, very knowledgable. Decor is old world with a touch of quirkiness topped with modern efficiency. Check out the lobby's metal tree - look for the monkeys. On loan bath robes are animal prints! The evening reception with snacks, wine, is an added bonus. Free wifi if you sign up for their rewards program online. Otherwise it is $10. Casual to formal dress - you will feel very comfortable here. The staff treats you as if you are family - it was hard to leave this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good!”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: great location, friendly sraff shame abouyt the small rooms but otherwise was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “good and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: timetraveller64
Reviews.Content: excellent service and great value for money, very special hotel with good food and friendly staff. the hotel is dog friendly which adds an extra home-feeling to the hotel, there is always one or two dogs in reception. between 17-1800 hrs there was wine tasting in the lobby as well as free massage and wii for the kids. small but good fitness center. the location is very central and close to the cable car and union square as well as many good restaurants. we would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, questionable area”
Reviews.Author: traveler4everFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for three nights in July 2011. The hotel is a very nice Kimpton property with a complimentary wine hour with massages. The Sangria was awesome! The rooms were a but on the small side, but the amenities more than made up for it. Caution - this hotel is just a couple of blocks off of Union Square, a very popular upscale shopping area. However, there are several homeless people in the area and we found it nerveracking to step out of the hotel and be bombarded with begging homeless people as we walked to Union Square. The hotel needs to make sure they steer clear of the hotel entrance. Such a lovely hotel in a not so lovely area because of all the homeless/derelicts in the vicinity. If you can stand it - I was born and raised in NYC and even I was a bit put off - the Hotel Monaco may be an option for your stay in San Francisco as it is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Betsy1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monaco for 3 nights in a junior suite and really liked the hotel. We had four in a room, which was a little tight, but it worked fine. The location was great, close to Union Square shops and walking distance to many places in the city. The rooms were average size, but very comfortable and unique in design and decor. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The concierge was great about making restaurant reservations and suggestions. Very nice wine/cheese/snack receptions in lobby each evening at 5. Had on the street room on third floor which was a bit noisy with street sounds. Overall, a great choice for a hotel, much preferable to larger hotel setting.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravellots2
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to San Francisco last minute and decided to stay at Hotel Monaco... and we were not disappointed. We loved everything about this hotel... the ambience and service were excellent, and the location was very good. The beds were VERY comfy and the Frette sheets were soft as butter! They also have complimentary wine in the late afternoons. I highly recommend this property as it is very well thought out.

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Kateb07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August. We had a standard room which was very nice albeit a bit small but we was expecting this. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet as we did not overlook the street. The hotel was very clean and all the staff we came across were very friendly and helpful. We requested a late check out on our last day and we were able to have the room until 1pm and they stored our luggage for us until we left at 3.30 pm which was very useful. Ensure you ask for the information sheet which the hotel provides on restaurant recommendations and what is happening in the area during that month – it would be nice if this was automatically left in the rooms as I only knew about this from an email conversation I had with the hotel prior to my stay so I asked for the information sheet – we were not automatically provided with it. The hotel offers a wine evening between 5pm and 6pm every evening, however, we were only able to take advantage of this on 2 occasions. It would be nice if this was extended to 7pm to enable more guests to take advantage. The complimentary tea and coffee in the morning was very nice as they also offer take-away cups which we could get on our way out. We ate in the restaurant on our first night and found the food to be of a high standard. Continental breakfast was included in our rate so we ate at the hotel every day and we were able to purchase additional items off the full menu. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to Union Square – it is on the edge of Union Square, however, at night this was not the most pleasant walk so we did do some quick walking although did not feel the need for a taxi. We were told by locals of what areas to avoid – namely the tenderloin area which is not too far from the hotel so be careful not to walk in the wrong direction. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the front on the cable cars (once you get on them!) and we used them to get us to and from the front when we went to the front. Would we stay here again? Yes, the hotel was very clean and comfortable in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: todd c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the beginning of our vacation. This is a beautiful hotel. Kimpton is a first-class operation with reasonably priced boutique hotels. We got a very good rate ($168) by becoming a member of their "In Touch" club (free). There are other perks for "In Touch" members too. We were a little worried about the neighborhood. There are conflicting reviews of this part of town. We had not problems and the walk from the Powell St. BART station was quick and easy. However, it is on the very edge of the Union Square shopping district and the neighborhood deteriorates quickly if you walk west or south. After carrying our luggage all day, it would have been nice if they offered to help us with luggage. I assume the bell man was helping someone else, but I would have thought the front desk would have stepped up to help, but no offer was made. The restaurant (Grand Cafe) was very nice. A grand room with whimsical art work. Perhaps a bit pricey, but I rather expect that for a hotel restaurant. There was a free wine reception ever evening, which was quite nice. The free coffee service in the morning was very nice. Room was small, but again that is expected in an older place, and how much room does two people really need?. The TV needed upgrading. They had some trouble finding me a key for the mini-bar ($10 free stuff for In-Touch members). We also got a free bottle of wine for using the "secret password" when we checked in. The biggest problem was with the "complimentary town car service to the financial district" that is advertised on their web site. I asked 6 different people and got 6 different answers about this service, including "it doesn't exist", "it isn't complementary", "it can't be reserved", "can be arranged at the front desk". etc... In the end, despite previous assurances that it would work for us, the door man said "No, you can't use it. The Ferry Building isn't in the Financial District". So we took the bus. However in the end, despite a few minor problems, I feel we got a deluxe hotel in a great location for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: baltimorebound
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights following a week of so so hotels. Couldnt be happier. The rooms are charming and cozy, with the most comfortable beds ever. The location was great and everyone at the hotel goes out of their wAy to be friendly. I would definitely stay here again. Hotel has a great vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoeCA
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for the second time at the Monaco because my partner and I wanted to get away from home for the night. This hotel stikes the perfect balance between feeling pampered, but not being stuffy. The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable. I have only stayed in the "parlor & junior suites" which were a decent size, but with bathrooms that are pretty standard (more luxurious accomodations are available, but I was only staying the night, so I opted for the smaller suite). My favorite part of the hotel are the sitting areas with the large fireplaces. They are the perfect place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine (the hotel offers a nightly wine and appetizer hour). I have also enjoy the restaurant and bar at the hotel dozens of times. On my most recent visit the hotel had live jazz until midnight in the bar area which was a great way to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DStepler
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - very funky decor. Superb service & friendly staff! Crazy to pay $50 for parking though but I guess that is common in San Fran

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the the Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Q2SHOOT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights at the start of our roadtrip to Los Angeles. It was a pleasant stay and well located to visit the sights of SF. The service and restaurant was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Union Square Gem!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper155004
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel right on the edge of Union Square. The staff are all friendly and helpful, offering suggestions on areas to visit (and not visit), dining, shopping, transportation and more. My check-in was smooth and welcoming and as a Kimpton Member, I even got a credit to "raid the mini-bar". My room was delightful - clean & fresh with funky decor and a bed that made you want to sleep all day long. The rooms in San Franscisco tend to be small however this one had a desk for working, a good sized armoir with drawers and extra tables and an arm chair. The bathroom vanity was large enough hold all personal items and the closet had loads of hangers! The hosted wine reception is a great place to meet up with other guests and strike up new friendships or just relax at the end of the day. The only drawback was that the spa area was being worked on during the time I was there, however, they offered a discounted rate on in-room servies to compensate. It did not bother me however as I was too busy to take advantage of them this time. I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: Cwright5
Reviews.Content: Everything here is wonderful from the staff to the amenities to the location to the adorable rooms, even gave us a gift of champagne for our honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Better than average with some quircks”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for several nights. It is in a borderline area of San Francisco (Union Square on Gear Street). Union Square can be seedy and there is a fair number of "street culture" in the immediate area. To be fair, most of the hotels in the area share a similar ambiance given the area's proximity to the sketchy "tenderloin" area. This hotel is trying very hard to be hip and pet friendly. If you have a pet, thats great. If you dont care for dogs, you may have an issue with this place. Dogs are privileged guests here. Several are on duty at the front desk area. Its cute but again if you dont want to be around canines, suggest you look else where. The rooms are comfortable, but can be noisy if they face Geary or the side street. No views to speak of at this hotel. The evening wine hour is a nice perk if your around but I missed it most nights of my stay because it ended around six. Check out was not great as the computers were down. The gym was a good cardio set up, also a small spa facility was a plus. Overall, a cute hotel if your in the mood.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool boutique hotel in heart of San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: GymboMom
Reviews.Content: JUST returned from a stay at this hotel with my sister, daughter and niece. My sister found it at a great rate and it was a gem of a hotel! The decor of the hotel is gorgeous - beautiful lobby and sitting areas. There was always a doorman outside to assist with directions or hailing a taxi if needed. The location was central to everything - we walked down to the wharf - a long walk, but definitely doable! (about 24 city blocks) A few blocks to the left of hotel is Chinatown and two blocks up was Powell and easy access to the cable cars, Union Square and lots of shopping. A convenient Walgreen's is located directly across the street if you need any water, snacks or toiletries. Starbucks is a short walk away for a great quick breakfast. The hotel always had water and a special "refresher" drink in the lobby when you walked in if you needed something right then. Everyday at 5 pm the hotel offered a wine reception for one hour. It was advertised as a wine/beer/mixed drinks/sangria reception with chef inspired offerings. The chef inspired offering the night we went was pretzels - so a little bit of a let down. They were also only offering sangria, a white wine and a red wine. We still enjoyed the free beverages during the hour and thought it was a nice touch. Our room was great - perfectly sized for the four of us. Very nice thread count on the sheets, beds were great and we were given option of feather pillows, foam or cotton. Nice toiletries as well - Aveda products. Our room was very clean and stocked with plenty of towels, hangers, etc. The staff was very helpful, especially with dining recommendations or with directions. My niece got sick the night before we checked out and they let us stay in our room several hours past check out until it was time for us to depart for the airport. This allowed my niece to rest until we had to leave and this helped very much in her recovery so she wasn't sick while we were flying! This was a huge plus for us and the staff could not have been helpful, especially when we needed the extra help! The only steep thing about the hotel is parking - self park is $45 or valet is $50. We opted for the valet. But parking is expensive EVERYWHERE in San Francisco, so if you drive in, just figure parking into your trip costs. Would definitely stay here again - for the location, value, and hotel staff that made this a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duthiedon
Reviews.Content: This beautiful boutique hotel is located in San Francisco in a great location. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean, and we loved the canopy beds. I'll be recommending this hotel to friends and family. Although we didn't bring our pets, we were impressed that they advertised being pet friendly, and even have a dog mascot :)

Reviews.Title: “A good value near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: tjmm11
Reviews.Content: The wine reception is pretty nice, and the reception room is a fine place to get coffee in the mornings. The lobby is beautiful, and I wish we'd had access to it, but it was closed for a private event. Our room, a junior suite, was huge. The room itself was pretty nice, and I love the Aveda toiletries. The staff was friendly. The price was right. We ate one night at the restaurant and our food was not good. And I got a massage at the hotel's spa, and it was absolutely terrible. So we'd consider staying there again, but I'd avoid the restaurant and spa for certain!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Loved the attention to detail & fun extras!”
Reviews.Author: Andilulu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night during the Christmas season to enjoy a piece of holiday San Francisco. The hotel was absolutely gorgeous, the lobby and lounge areas were a pleasure to spend time in. Check in was quick & friendly. The rooms definitely have character. It's definitely a classic building, and the decor/room arrangement was perfect for the size of the room. We had everything we needed without feeling like the room was too small. Ice was not available on every floor, but it was easy to find, and the common areas are so nicely decorated that it was no problem to travel to a different floor for ice. There was flavored water in the lobby, and of course the complimentary tea/coffee in the morning, and wine/snacks in the evening! Such a nice treat before heading out for the evening. After checkout, we enjoyed some hot chocolate in lounge and ended up spending half our afternoon there by the fireplace, it was so cozy! I hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... service lets it down”
Reviews.Author: Ozaqua
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is nice in a "ye olde world" kind of way, but rooms are small - more like hotels in Europe than the USA. The lounge area with fireplace is a great venue to sit and read, work, whatever. The concierge are great, but other service areas let it down. You can wait for ages at the front desk for the staff to finish chatting, room servicing is very basic, and the minibar was replenished twice on a 6 day trip. The wifi is slow and flakey, especially in guest rooms. Some websites list the location as Union Square. Location is not all that desirable, on the edge of the Tenderloin district, and you WILL be approached several times by beggars, some of whom are very aggressive when their request is declined. Crossing the road to Walgreens and back, I was approached 7 times! One of the concierges does his best to move them on, but can only do so much. For the price, move a bit closer to Union Square and you can do much better. Spa is closed for renovations at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: annemvb
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay a this hotel. The area was nice and we found all of the concierge to be very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another beautiful Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: NJBrooklynborn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is absolutely brilliant- everything I'd hoped it would be. The decor is fabulous- elegant and quirky at the same time. There is a whimsical feel to every detail. It's true that the rooms are small, but certainly big enough for my family of three. Comfortable beds, beautifully appointed rooms in every way. All special requests are handled immediately. ( The Grande Cafe is GORGEOUS but very expensive, so we only had breakfast there once.) Fantastic location!!! Aside from the lovely surroundings, I must say that the absolute best thing about Hotel Monaco was Sean at the front desk. He is so pleasant, so knowledgeable and certainly one of the best concierge I have ever come in contact with. He definitely made our stay! Sean is several cuts above every other employee at this hotel and every other hotel we stayed at during our entire California Coast vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Alan310
Reviews.Content: Nice experience. Hotel staff and management was helpful in getting me into a room situation that was comfortable for my whole family. Close to Union Square in the tenderloin, so there are some issues with street people, but it is a city after all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fordb81
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night break in San Fran, and felt compelled to write a review on this hotel (I don't normally). The hotel is first class in all aspects; the staff, the rooms, the food to name but a few. The adjoined Grande Cafe serves excellent reasonably priced food, and the hotel breakfast is also excellent. The only minor down side is that the hotel sits on the north edge of the Tenderloin, which is not a place to visit at night (drug dealers loiter on corners), that said it is only 2 blocks west of Union Sq. Overall, an excellent choice if you are visiting this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Well-Appointed Property”
Reviews.Author: azulstar
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed both of our stays at this stylish, well run property. While the decor may be a little flamboyant for some tastes, it certainly provides a pleasant departure from the typical mainstream hotel experience. Monaco lobbies are feasts of color and theatrical flourishes, decked out with stylish furniture, bold fabrics and other touches which establish a cheerful tone. The presence of guests' well behaved dogs also lends a rather homey atmosphere to a clearly chic, upscale experience. Despite all the elegance, this is a mid-tier, mid-price hotel, an affordable luxury which provides quite a treat for a vacation or get-away weekend. The rooms carry on the color and drama of the lobbies and are very comfortable and well maintained. We have selected suites on each visit and find the extra space well worth the cost since the standard rooms have felt a little small at the Monaco's property in Denver. The standards of the hotel are quite high despite the moderate price point and all the amenities from the jazzy robes to large marble bathrooms to well chosen furniture reflect well on the management of this chain. The staff are wonderful and very professional. We especially approve of the room service and bar dining option at the Monaco. While the formal restaurant is there if you need it, its menu is unexceptional and there are better dining experiences all over San Francisco. The bar, however, is a very comfortable place to hang out and dine on an excellent selection of various bar foods from burgers to calamari to raw oysters. The presence of this bar dining option is a real plus in considering the Monaco since it takes all the pressure off the dinner hour when a major dining experience may not be required every night of your stay. Our one slight negative on this hotel is its location which is off Union Square rather than on it. While two extra blocks aren't a huge deal, the twentieth time you walk them could matter to you. Otherwise, the Monaco is an excellent choice near the very best part of a truly enchanting, vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: contraltomo
Reviews.Content: If you're in San Francisco you must go to this hotel. The staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms just fine and there's a welcome from Lucy the little Pug at the desk. If you’re e missing your pet from home they will give you a goldfish for your room to keep you company. In addition each morning there is free tea and coffee in the sitting room and, even better, wine tasting each evening between 5 and 6. Often the chef appeared with very tasty nibbles at this time too. Who could ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: H1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco for only one night at the conclusion of a Northern CA trip. My only regret is that we did not have one more night to spend. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out we could not have been more impressed with the hotel and staff. The staff was wonderfully accomodating and our room was spacious, comfortable and "fun". The hotel has a great lively vibe especially around nightly happy hour. We had a late night meal at the restaurant next door (i think its called the Grand Cafe) and this was our best meal on the trip with an added bonus of a 3 piece Jazz band for entertainment. I will definately be going back to San Francisco and Hotel Monaco will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ChilenaDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Hotel Monaco San Francisco. We loved it. The staff was friendly when we arrived and the room was very nice and clean. It was a bit small but not bad at all. We booked through hotels.com and got a great rate too. The location was fantastic. It is located in Union Square within a few blocks of the cable car route. There was tons of shopping near by and may restaurtants to choose from. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and will stay there again when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful conclusion to California trip”
Reviews.Author: JessNY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco was the last stop on our anniversary celebration trip. I'd heard wonderful things about this hotel and was not disappointed. We were upgraded to a larger room, thanks to the wonderful concierge. The decor in this hotel is lovely and the room was no exception. This upgraded room was huge for a boutique hotel in an older building. The bed was comfortable. We even had a companion goldfish with us, courtesy of the hotel. We enjoyed the complimentary wine hour -- that is a great Kimpton touch. When five o'clock rolled around, there was a sudden onslaught of other guests into the room where the wine hour is held. Too funny -- no one passes up free wine! We hit up the front desk twice for restaurant recommendations. They sent us to some excellent places. I'd definitely return. The service was great and I felt the value was good for a nicer hotel in a popular city. The parking fee was steep, but that seems to be the case everywhere in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Fee”
Reviews.Author: twochasmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and parked our car in valet. The over night fee is $50.00 plus tax, which does seem very steep, even for San Francisco. When we went to check out, they tried to charge us for an oversized CAR, $65.00 a night. After 20 minutes of the staff checking with valet, they determined that our CAR was not oversized and gave us a refund. Good thing I looked closely because they only gave us half of the refund. After another 10 minutes I was able to get all my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Fun Hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: robsaSyd
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel and it was absolutely excellent. Initially I was a little concerned about cleanliness and smells, as it is a pet friendly hotel, but there is absolutely nothing to worry about! The hotel maintains the high standard expected from a 4 star place, and I loved the presence of a goldfish in my room and of the "Director, pet services" (a little dog) behind the reception counter. Our room was amazing, quite large, well set out and super clean. The hotel staff really paid attention to the little details. The location is excellent (a short walk to union square) and the adjacent Cafe Grand provides excellent food and drinks. I think Hotel Monaco is now my favourite!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Very Special place with a great buzz.”
Reviews.Author: the_moomins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kimpton SFO for 3 days with some friends after having attended a friends wedding in Las Vegas and a bit of a road trip through Nevada and California afterwards Located in theatre district of SFO, this hotel offers all the mod cons you would expect from the Kimpton brand. Union Square is just a couple of minutes walk down the road, and next door to the hotel is a fantastic brasserie serving delicious food, which is obviously quite the hit also with the locals, as the place is always pretty packed with diners. I would recommend this hotel for solo, couples and business travellers looking for a touch of sophistication. Attentive and friendly service were complimented with a great and very stylish hotel. The bedrooms are well appointed, luxurious bathrooms and the huge beds ultra comfortable. The hotel provides in-room hifi and stereo facilities into which you can plug/charge your Ipod and play music. There is also a very large flat screen TV to watch DVDs with the complimentary DVD player. The hotel provides complimentary wine tasting evenings - offering the opportunity to meet other guests as well as 'taster' back neck and shoulder massages by the in-house spa. I would highly recommend this hotel as I absolutely loved my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful last night of our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: sanazMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday, July 2nd for a last night in the city on our way home from the wine country. We had booked the free parking package which was a terrific deal for a spot so close to Union Square- we pulled up in front of the hotel and our car was valet parked for free in supervised ramp around the corner. Check in was without difficulty, and we were even given cards for two free cocktails at the beautiful bar and our bags were stored while we waited for our to finish being cleaned. They also gave us two cards for a complimentary continental breakfast the next morning in the gorgeous restaurant! A few minutes after arriving in our very cute, clean, and rather spacious (for downtown SF) room, room service arrived with complimentary champagne and a note from the manager congratulating us on our wedding! The hotel was in a terrific location- a few blocks from Union Square and the cable car line, walking distance to Chinatown and North Beach- we walked to Coit Tower for a gorgeous view of the whole city- Overall, a terrific experience. The Hotel Monaco is definitely one we would return to when visiting San Francisco-

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: savvytrave11er
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice and absolutely love it. Great location, friendly staff and lovely rooms. The Wine Hour is a must! Recommended to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, small room, not-so-great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tomandcynthia
Reviews.Content: We are definitely not high society, but my sister and I were traveling through SF and decided to try a boutique hotel. From the time our car arrived at the front door, the service was beyond reproach. The valet treated our Honda Pilot as if it were a BMW. They were personable, friendly and helpful. Even retrieved our coats from the car after it had been parked. The front desk was also personable and very helpful and we did ask a lot of questions. The hotel decor was absolutely beautiful, Our room was also beautiful, very clean but very small (very small). The only fly-in-the-ointment was the mediocre restaurant, the Grand Cafe. The cafe decor was beautiful, the waitstaff friendly and helpful, BUT, the most important ingredient is the food and it was very bland, to put it kindly. For breakfast, I had the quiche and my sister had the burrito. The quiche had the texture of, and tasted like, egg beaters with a tough crust. My sister also commented on the bland taste of her dish. Since everything else had been top notch, we went into the restaurant expecting excellence, never thinking to check the cafe's ratings. Big mistake. Costly mistake. I would NEVER choose to eat here and that takes away a star from the hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but disappointed in service”
Reviews.Author: 1drmnt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and nice location. However, when we arrived, with our daughter they put us in an incredibly small room for 3 people. The front desk people were not very helpful and told us sold out. After persistence, we were given another double room, it was not an upgrade, which was much better and what we should have received originally. They were understaffed at the front desk and have no concierge so getting any knowledgeable advice has been challenging throughout our stay. Both days upon return our room was not cleaned, once at 2:30 and once at 5:00. The front desk told us they were understaffed because of a holiday weekend and not friendly at all, again we had to persist to get room cleaned. Thank goodness for the bell staff. They have been the shining stars during our stay. We have stayed at Kimpton Hotels before and not had these frustrations. Beautiful Hotel but not properly staffed. ( also asked for a softer pillow and was told not available)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: As others have said this is a nice reasonably priced hotel near Union Square. Yes rooms are small by US standards but clean and nice. An SF local friend called it "a poor man's W Hotel" which is pretty accurate. Small things you don't initially notice keep it from being a 4 star hotel (like old-school TV's rather than flat screens, small rooms, etc. But the people really make up for any shortcomings. Very friendly and helpful and it definitely made the trip more enjoyable. Neighborhood is good but if you head in the wrong direction it's not so great. Parking is an obscene $49/night valet. But right there is private valet garage that charges a slightly less obscene $36/night so I would park there. It's a good deal away from Fishermans Wharf but just hop on the trolley and you'll be there in no time. We walked to ATT Park to catch a game but it was a pretty far walk. Overall the reviews here are accurate and I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pangia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Hotel Monaco for business, and thought the hotel was very good. The cost per night was reasonable during my stay, and staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel has obviously been around for a while, and if you are a fan of sleek modernism this is probably not the hotel for you. With that said it was clean and comfortable, with a small fitness center and hot tub which are free for guest use. Room service was quick and food okay, but service in the lobby restaurant was quite slow. The area the hotel is in can be a little dicey block by block (as it can in much of SF), but easy walking distance to Union Square, Nob Hill, etc. I would stay here again if the rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: cpniner
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at a Kimpton Hotel and we were very pleased. Interesting artwork in the lobby area. A very comfortable, and warm feeling hotel in a great location. Close to Union Square but not too noisy. Wine and snacks in the evening. This is a pet friendly hotel which gave me pause(no pun intended), but I requested a non-pet room which they assured me it was, and I had no complaints. The hotel parking is pricey, $50/night, but there is a place across the street which was half the price, a small garage, very easy to park there.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great Kimpton Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gretchenenders
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a half dozen other Kimpton hotels, so you could say I'm a fan. And the Hotel Monaco San Francisco doesn't disappoint. Great central location. Comfortable room with all the amenities you could possibly need. The lovely wine hour. And the best service one could hope for. From the front desk to the bellman to housekeeping to room service, everyone greeted us with a genuine smile. Absolutely great stay, already looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Fun and Very Affordable”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: We traveled a short distance to again get away for a San Francisco weekend. As we were planing to attend a play and experience some night life we wanted to stay in the downtown/theater section of San Francisco. The Hotel Monaco is right on Geary Street, a main East/West thoroughfare that runs from Market Street to the ocean. The hotel is within a block of the A.C.T. Theater and many fine eateries are also a short walk or brief taxi ride away. This was our first stay at the Monaco. As we entered the hotel we were very impressed with the high domed ceilings that gives a sense of a vastness of space in the foyer and the adjacent spaces off of the lobby. Pictures of bi-planes and balloons are painted on the ceilings off of the entrance. The "living room" adjacent to the lobby is comfortable with overstuffed chairs and a long high back sofa. An evening happy hour is celebrated in this area. Once checked in we were welcomed by a brightly lit hallway featuring bright red walls when we arrived at our floor. Our room was just the right size and all of the expected sundries were included in this immaculate space. The view from our room did overlook a storage area for garbage dumpsters but we chose to look up and see just a bit of the downtown area. Although the view wasn't much, being at the back of the property insured a very quiet and peaceful couple of night's sleep. As with all of the hotels of this chain, the room furnishings are kitschy and a bit over the top. The room colors are bold. The wall paper was silver and black vertical stripes. There was what can best be described as an awning hanging directly over the bed and it was accessorized with pairs of mens' trouser belts. Believe me, I'm not making this up - just reporting what was there! A fun room. The entire hotel staff were very professional and it is apparent that they are proud to work at The Monaco. Adjacent and connecting to the Hotel Monaco is the Grand Cafe Bistro and Restaurant. We ate brunch at the Grand cafe and the food was very good Between five and seven the bar at the restaurant serves up some very tasty raw and baked oysters for about a buck-fifty per oyster, and we enjoyed a pre-night-on-the-town snack of oysters and champagne for a very modest sum. We have already added the Hotel Monaco to our list of places that we will be sure to return to when we want to get away to The City By the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, funky cool room. Too bad no complementary internet”
Reviews.Author: NewbieTubes
Reviews.Content: Landed a queen room during a flash sale - visit their site for 50% or more off. Pro: location blocks from city transport, shopping, tourist spots. room was quiet. service was excellent - example: we returned our rental car but need to fill up on gas first. while I checked in, the bell hop gave driving instructions to nearby gas station. Efficient! con: Why on earth free internet is not offered baffles me in a hotel like this. Air in room felt a little stuffy, as if it hadn't been aired out in a while. Rom seemed very small for a queen size. Cons are not deal-breakers. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton does SF right,”
Reviews.Author: HowdyBub
Reviews.Content: Great location, unique decor, super friendly staff. This was a trip as a gift to my son, he was well pleased and had lots to say about that "Cool hotel Monaco"

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: countrynsw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Monaco, June 2011, and were very impressed. Hotel is centrally located to Union Square (2 / 3 blocks walking) and has some great restaurants within the local area. Reception was very helpful in recommending restaurants handy to the hotel. We ate a Mexican restaurant right across the road from the hotel, and it was the best mexican we have eaten. Hotel was clean, friendly staff and good facilities On the downside the rooms were quite small, but this not did not bother us, as we were out sightseeing most of the day. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has a cool feel to it.”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monaco twice in adjoining rooms with my daughters. There is something very cool about this place. The check-in was a bit long the last trip because although they had guaranteed me adjoining rooms when we arrived they didn't have any. The desk was very nice about it though and tried very hard to figure something out. We wound up across the hall which was just fine in the end. The hotel has a wine and cheese reception every night which is OK. The attached french bistro is excellent. Great either in the restaurant or at the bar for a nightcap. The location is pretty central to Union Square and the rest of the downtown area. Overall I enjoyed it here and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elvo73
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel paying on a travel website, half of the cost of their reservation system. We were there only for a night, the computer system was down but we were still able to check in. They have free happy hour from 5 to 6 pm. The lobby is nice and clean, they have a permanent table with water, and in the morning you can have coffee and tea as well. The rooms were not very big at all, I got an upgrade to a queen room from a "petite room" and I can say that it was only the bed in the middle, one extra small space next to the bed on each side, not big at all, new tv and also was a very quiet room even when we were 2 doors down the elevator. The bathroom was nice, only shower, but clean with aveda amenities and good towels. Parking was valet only for $40 a night. Safe place to stay at the embarcadero area.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You for another great stay”
Reviews.Author: TENNDAWG
Reviews.Content: We discovered Kimpton Hotels when my wife and I honeymooned in San Francisco 9 years ago and first stayed at The Prescott, which ironically is right around the corner from The Hotel Monaco. We were hooked with that first stay and never consider another property when we come back to San Francisco, or any other cities where Kimpton's are. We have actually stayed at Kimpton's Hotel Monaco in Washington DC. The Hotel Monaco is our fourth Kimpton property in San Francisco my wife and I have stayed at in the last 4 visits we've made to this great city. We chose it on this visit for 2 reasons - The first was the size of the room we could get at the price range we were willing to spend. There was no question we were going to stay at a Kimpton; the question was what the best room we could get for our money. The second was the fact that we had been inside this hotels lobby on a previous visit and said we definitely wanted to stay on one of our next visits. The hotel lobby is, in one word, spectacular! Our room was a Canopy room and for what we needed the room for, it was perfect. This was a weekend getaway and we stayed for only 2 nights. We knew on this particular visit, we weren't going to be staying in our room very much. All we were looking for was a quiet room with a nice bathroom. If you are the type of traveler who likes to have a room you can hang out in and watch TV, then you probably should consider a bigger/different room or another hotel. If you’re going to have more than a couple of suitcases and clothes for, say, a week, this probably won’t do for you. I believe they have bigger rooms there but we didn’t need one. For our needs, the 200 square feet was perfect! The bathroom was roomy enough for us and we felt that we could get dressed without stepping on each and had plenty of room for our suitcases and closet space for our clothes. Don't expect a sweeping panoramic city view either in the canopy room. It's a nice, comfortable hotel room with a great staff. If you want a view, get out and walk around - it's San Francisco after all! As for the hotel staff, they were the same great we've come to expect as Kimpton regulars. We had to ask for help with just about every aspect of our stay, like an early check-in & late check-out, dinner recommendations and reservations, and transportation to/from the airport and around the city. Everyone was just a tremendous help in making our stay a pure pleasure. But, in particular, I would like to say a special thank you to Mose. When my wife realized she did not bring a charger cord for her Blackberry, Mose went to another Kimpton property to get one for us. And then, told us to we could use for rest of our trip, take it home and just return it at the next Kimpton we stay at. No problem and we will. Just incredible service, thank you Mose! The location is only a couple of blocks away from Union Square where you can find the trolley or other public transportation to get you to other parts of the city. Chinatown is certainly within walking distance too. Cab rides to places like The Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf (The Buena Vista Cafe) are just a few dollars. A Taxi ride to/from SFO is a good 30 minutes and will cost you about $37. Considering that the cheapest shuttle is going to be about $32, it makes for the convenience of having choices to get to/from the airport so you can spend more time enjoying this city. Speaking of which, there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. My wife and I were very disappointed we didn't get to try the hotel's own Grand Cafe. We had heard good things about it and we have eaten at several Kimpton property restaurants and found them to be among the best in any city. We had planned to eat dinner there before our red-eye flight but were unable to make it back to the hotel in time. Oh well, next time, and yes there will be a next time! We loved everything about The Hotel Monaco. Make time in your stay for the Managers Wine Reception (they have it every Kimpton). We met some great people from Australia and the cupcakes they served (the cupcakes were a first, normally it's very tasty olives), and that's the type of thing you just can't get at a bigger chain. One thing that is never a surprise though is how Kimpton Hotels are always a wonderful part of our visits to the cities they are in. Thank you for yet another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the city!”
Reviews.Author: BZTravelerchi
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything bad about the Monaco. Lots of good things to say: Friendly and accommodating staff. Nice touches like the morning coffee service and flavored ice water in the lobby. Good quality wifi. Comfortable bed. Aveda bath products! Centrally located, close to Union Square and transit. VERY dog friendly! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Way to Celebrate a Milestone - 50th!”
Reviews.Author: rscrowe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Monaco where I had taken my husband in honor of his big 50 birthday (5/29). Upon arrival, we were able to check in early and the room was fantastic. We unpacked, freshened up and took out to see the sights. Upon our return, we had a chilled bottle of Champagne, with a nice note and picture frame from Mary at the front desk. What a fantastic birthday surprise! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the bubbly. Everyone at the hotel were very friendly and the location was perfect. As we were leaving the Hotel to head to Napa Valley, the bellhop -- whose name I did not catch, suggested we drive to Napa, over the Golden Gate Bridge -- he said it would be a more scenic route and it was. Thank you everyone for a wonderful stay at the Hotel Monaco. Your location, staff and little touches made my husband's birthday one to remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Accommodating, Spacious, Great location”
Reviews.Author: fishfriend22
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night voucher for any Kimpton hotel (purchased last Christmas via Jetsetter) so chose to utilize it for a weekend in San Fran. Of all the Kimpton hotels there, we felt the Union Square location was best (and loved the boutique feel of the Monaco vs the other Kimpton options). This hotel is literally right next door to The Clift, which I'm personally not a fan of... being an LA resident, we have plenty of Phillipe Stark-clubby-atmosphere-sceney opportunities. Plus the rooms at the Monaco are MUCH more spacious than the Clift. We arrived on the early Sat morning flight (in the city by 8am) and had hoped to leave our bags at the hotel while we explored the city until afternoon check-in. We were most pleasantly surprised to learn that our room was not only ready but that they'd let us check in so early... score! The staff was most friendly and accommodating, offering to make transportation arrangements for us throughout our stay. The complimentary fresh spa water (strawberry, orange, etc) was a nice touch, along with the morning coffee bar and afternoon wine hour. The bathrooms were super clean and had plenty of available amenities. We didn't order room service but it was good to see a few yummy healthy options listed for each meal below the usual decadence. The only reason I took off a star (and would rate the experience Very Good vs Excellent) - Being a fan of spas of all kinds, I partially chose this hotel for the 24hr fitness room, sauna, jacuzzi and steam room. We had inquired about the spa hours (9am-9pm, and someone could let us in after hours if necessary). I was mainly looking forward to relaxing in the warm sauna but was quite disappointed to find the sauna 'out of order'. Ok fine, managed to enjoy the steam & jacuzzi in it's place. The 2nd day there was a 'closed' sign on the jacuzzi as well. We called the front desk, who cited 'maintenance'. My husband saw the maintenance guy later, who mentioned they couldn't get the chemical balance right in the jacuzzi. Being Memorial Day weekend (and the fact that this is a Kimpton, known for their service and the hotel seemed pretty busy/full) I'm surprised this wasn't taken care of. Even on day 3 only the steam room was available. Overall, we were very pleased with the rooms, our stay and the service. Hopefully next time all the spa amenities will be available for enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “My accommodation was wonderful. Certainly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Oliver_Hank
Reviews.Content: During my short vacation trip in SF last month I stayed with hotel Monaco. To me it was certainly one of the best accommodations in SF if not the best. I have stayed at a few other hotels in the city but my experience with Monaco was more than expected. My room was averagely sized, don’t know if even the others were similar or not. I was alone so a large room was needed at all. The bathroom was surprisingly bigger. You cannot expect such large bathroom after coming from a small room. It had a considerably bathtub that again came as a surprise. Interiors were done minutely which will certainly take your eyes for some time. Inside the room it was stripped pattern curtains but in the lounge things were done differently done. It looked obvious that a great attention has been paid to interiors and designs. The reception and restaurant areas were equally wonderful examples of great interiors. The staffs were amiable and looked keen to help all the time. I would like to choose certainly Monaco If I ever plan my holidays in SF again. Monaco is my recommendation for all.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maxmayo
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Francisco, tired after travelling from UK, lovely hotel, allocated queen bed room but asked to change and upgraded to large king room. Reception and concergie staff so helpful and friendly. Wine hour from 5-6pm was a nice touch and definitely what is needed after a long flight !! Free tea and coffee in lounge from 6am is good too with 'to go' cups to take back to bed. Walgreens and liquor and deli directly over the road for all your needs and if bar is closed when you get back from dinner, just walk 4 doors down to SWIG Bar for a late drink. Stayed in Kimpton Hotels before but have to say this was the best and a definite recommend if staying in SF as so near to Union Square. Great Breakfast, but if you are a brit ask for engilsh breakfast tea and well done toast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: josephinejoybaker
Reviews.Content: One of the best I have stayed in. Staff was amazing, room very comfortable and clean. Terrific location. Would go again. Am a Kimpton convert.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where even the dogs feel special”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last four days of our California holiday. Having seen many 5-star hotels around the world and being spoiled with American hospitality we were both amazed. We (probably) upgraded our room but it was a very cozy suite where you'd actually like to sit down with a bottle of wine and a doggie bag from the cheesecake factory, watching Conan. Speaking of dogs, they've got front desk dogs. Yes, a golden retriever was shaking paws with us wearing his tie (during work hours). If you arrive early, you have have a glass of wine with a complementary massage, provided the children don't throw their Wii-remotes at you. When we come back to SF, if we have kids, we'll stay here. The only feedback I can give is that the sauna was cold (to the staff: keep it at 70-85 degrees celcius, not at room temperature) and that a front desk staff recommended a mexican restaurant that had bad food. The place was full, but only thanks to the margaritas which we didn't have. This is a great hotel, can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moppet_11
Reviews.Content: First time staying at a Kimpton Hotel and was not disappointed. Very friendly staff - helpful concierge deserves special mention (Thanks Eddie and Benni). Overall, great location, with plenty of inexpensive eateries nearby, Make sure you visit Bangkok Cafe along Powell Street (next to Tad Steaks) for great Thai Food. Thanks TA for another great hotel recommendation - Im now convinced that yours is one of the best and reliable travel sources!!

Reviews.Title: “It felt like Home”
Reviews.Author: brdyboop
Reviews.Content: While traveling thru San Franciso, my friend and I stayed at Hotel Monaco in the beginning of our trip - after driving to Yosimite, Lake Tahoe and several other places, we decided to end our vacation back at The Hotel Monaco. The doorman, Benje, not only remembered us but treated us like family. Everything there is so luxurious and you are treated so nicelky by everyone. I would definitly go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor Comes through Again!”
Reviews.Author: SandyToesMinnesota
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip, I trusted TA travellers and once again, was not disappointed with their recommendation of the Monaco in SF near Union Square. The hotel is like stepping back into the gilded era of the early 1900's with painted fresco ceilings, lattice-work railings, and massive fireplaces. The room itself faced Geary street , but was still fairly quiet - heard the occasional siren or engine. The room was decorated with funky green and yellow striped wallpaper and a large circular mirror in the sitting area with 2 Asian patterned chairs. There was a nice-sized functional desk between the beds and a large corner armoir that housed the TV and a mini-bar plus fridge. The bedding and pillows were some of the most comfortable I have come across on my travels. The bathroom was equipped with Aveda products, a hairdryer, plus cotton balls and q-tips. There was also a list of essentials the front desk would provide if needed. Plenty of room for 2 people. The front desk was outstanding with check-in, as well as sight-seeing and dining suggestions. I had emailed the concierge 2 nights before my stay to request 2 beds as a friend was able to join me - and the request was granted with a smile. The location is within walking distance (3 blocks) to Union Square and the Cable care and (5 blocks) to the gate of Chinatown. The doorman suggested not to venture to the west or south due to it being a rougher neighborhood and not as visitor-friendly. There is a very nice cafe (but expensive) adjacent to the hotel, as well as many dining options within a short walk. Our favorite for breakfast was a small diner at the corner of Geary and Mason (same side of street as hotel) and dinner was a time to venture out - had fabulous homemade raviolli at Scala's on Powell, and tasty chicken and broccoli at R and G in Chinatown along with the freshest fish of the trip! It was a fun trip and I've already recommended the Monaco to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Orthodromic
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a room at 83 degrees despite thermostat set at 65. I called down and ...eventually someone came to confirm it really was quite hot. 3 hours later and after significant perspiration (no offer to exchange rooms) maintenance fixed the fan, but NOT the AC and declared it fixed. By then it was night and I had opened the window. The next day my wife arrived to....82deg after a long flight and hike. After 3 hours they finally agreed to just give us another room. My wife forgot my phone charger while moving all my unpacked luggage. So I called from the new room's bathroom after finally realizing the new room's phone did not work. They had already put a guest in the room with no AC and never really looked into finding my charger until 2 days later at my insistence. Cheap wine at 5pm and good coffee in the morning is nice, but does not make up for poor facilities and a lack of true service. This hotel presents the worst aspects of a chain without consistently providing the best details of a stand alone. To be fair, the location is great, Walgreens is across the street, and the daytime desk/door are friendly. PS Don't walk south at night. San Fran has some very real risks in the wrong neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ambtravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Monaco after our wedding. I have family in the city, so I've never had need for a hotel in SF before, but we decided to treat ourselves to a suite for two nights to celebrate. We checked in fairly late,but didn't have a single issue getting our room or ordering room service. The hotel provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and a handwritten note congratulating us on our wedding. Our suite was nicely sized, with an amazingly comfortable bed and spacious bathroom with a huge tub. The decor was so nice that we joked about hiring somebody to redo our house in the same way! We ordered room service twice while staying, and both times the food was excellent and promptly delivered. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and I now look for Kimpton hotels whenever I need a hotel because I was so impressed with the quality of the hotel and service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a 4*?”
Reviews.Author: millscs
Reviews.Content: No turn down service; house keeping calls you at 10am if they are unable to get into your room to clean because you are still sleeping and bar/restaurant/food service finishes at 10:30pm on a Sunday and 11pm on a weekday. The furnishings may be nice, and the wine evening is a great touch, but this is not a hotel for anyone that likes to sleep past 9am or might want a drink on returning home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 123haha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for four nights over spring break with my mom and two boys. We all enjoyed our stay. From the moment we arrived (9:30 pm on a Friday night) until we left (sad to leave our pet goldfish!) it was always a pleasure to be there. The complimentary wine reception was a nice touch, especially the Wi for kids to play on while the adults relaxed!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!! EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: j0420travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is in a great location near Union Sq. Easy walking distance from chinatown and Union Sq. The rooms were very clean and the staff was excellent. The entire stay was pleasant and they went out of the way to accommodate my every need. The hotel is very close to Dotties Restaurant we waited 45 min for a table. The restaurant food was good but not worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lazgrl
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Monaco for three nights and enjoyed it greatly. Only a short walk to Union Square and tons of great shopping. The hotel is more beautiful in person than the pictures can show. The entire staff was always very helpful. I believe his name was Jon who was a doorman, gave my husband great recommendations on places to go for imported beer. He was really spot on! Valet very timely when ever we needed the car. ($49 a day for valet or $20 for self parking around the corner). We loved the funky deco in the rooms and the bed slept amazingly. Loved the animal print bathrobes! Breakfast at Grand Cafe is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of luxury, a little funk”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Monaco over Christmas and found the staff cheerful, engaging and helpful at every turn. In the welcoming, fireside public spaces and in the rooms, the decor is a little bit Alice, but it is more lively and lush than overwhelming. We chose a small suite which was a very comfortable size with a separate living room, but my mother's room was a bit small and over-stuffed with large furniture and no drawers into which she could unpack. She was comfortable however, because we could share the living room through a connecting door. Her canopy bed was a nice touch too. The Monaco is located between the upscale Union Square and the downscale Tenderloin, so expect to see a mix of high-life and low-life on the streets. It is convenient to the Theatre District, transit, shopping and museums like SFMOMA. The evening wine reception is a nice touch, and unlike most luxury hotels which charge a fortune for internet, you can get free Wi-Fi if you join their loyalty program. Parking fees in the city are not for the faint of heart, but you can save a little money by using a self-park garage around the block. Their brasserie Grand Cafe is upscale, hip and beautiful, but beware the slowest brunch in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: yaynay
Reviews.Content: A perfect base from which to explore San Francisco. Good value for money, helpful staff, friendly touches and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's generally fine; night staff not so reasonable”
Reviews.Author: AConferenceTraveler
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I'm a one-issue hotel seeker: if the place has no bed bugs, it's fine with me. Monaco appears to have none after my diligent search of my room, so it passes on that front. But, I did have one annoying experience with the staff in the wee hours of a Sat. 9 April that was annoying. I ended up in SF for a week for a conference but was very ill with a cold the entire time. The rooms have no small coffee makers like many do. I rarely use this, but desperately needed one this time to make theraflu, which is the only cold-symptom medication that works well for me. I spent most of the week getting hot water (kindly given for free) from Starbucks across street. But at 4AM on Saturday morning, I coughed myself awake, couldn't sleep, & got desperate. I went down looking to see if the morning coffee I was promised at check-in was out yet. It wasn't. I explained to front desk how ill I was, showed them the theraflu packet I was desperate to make, and asked if they could please get me some hot water. Porter arrived in 15 minutes with hot water and no mug. I asked for one, the porter said: "You have glasses, see!" I said, "no mugs, nothing with a handle". He said: "You have glasses." and left. I felt the easiest way not to make trouble was to go back downstairs and to get one of the mugs I'd seen out in big stacks in the coffee area downstairs. I got one, the front desk started saying: "The porter will be there soon". I said: "Yeah, he came, but brought no mug for me; I came to get one". Answer: "Sir, don't take that mug. That's for a private function. You can't take that mug!" The guy kept yelling as I entered the elevator; I half-expected him to chase me up to my room to retrieve this mug I'd "stolen" from the private function. Now, this is an *empty* mug. It belongs to the hotel. I'm taking it back to my room, at the hotel! Do they really have so few mugs that I can't borrow one to prepare my cold medication at 4AM?
