He's really going to yell at a "mug stealing" customer at 4:30AM who's already told him that he's very sick and desperately needs to prepare some symptom medicine? I realize fully this is one poor decision by a night staffer not thinking through the situation. One shouldn't judge the whole hotel on one incident like this. I'll get over this minor thing, but I'm also unlikely to stay here again anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, enjoyable, cozy”
Reviews.Author: magellan74
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location for a visit to San Francisco. The staff is impeccable. I stayed in one of the canopy queen rooms and had a comfortable night sleep each night. The only complaint I had about the room was that the furniture was arranged in kind of a strange way where it was difficult to watch TV from the bed; however, I was there for a pleasure trip and did not stay in bed watching TV much at all. Unfortunately, there were no dressers for putting clothes in that I wanted to unpack. This arrangement may be due to the small size of this particular room. Closet space was somewhat limited as well. This is probably one of the trade offs for staying in an older, historic hotel. Overall, I found the hotel to be excellent overall. I wish I had taken advantage of the spa and wine reception while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our anniversary and this hotel truly exceeded our expectations (Although we chose it because we absolutely LOVED the Kimpton Epic in Miami). The location was great - a short walk from the BART train in Union Sq. and right in the heart of their theatre district. We loved the decor which is full of charm and whimsy. The service was amazing! Every night, they had a free cocktail hour with free chair messages too - which was a great way to unwind at the end of the day! The concierge was sooo helpful with great tips and restaurant recommendations. They even went so far as to send us up Champagne on our anniversary, and on the night we checked out, a thank you gift with a handwritten note! This hotel is very pet friendly too, which we loved, but if you're allergic to dogs and cats, this is something to keep in mind. They even had a pet "concierge," an adorable golden retriever, there a couple days a week to greet guests! We also loved the fact that you could get a goldfish in your room (at special request), which adds to the real homey feel of this hotel. Their hotel restaurant is also very good. We had breakfast there one day and really enjoyed it. This hotel is a total gem! It's a bit luxury and a bit of home right in the middle of a very hip city! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: gregghamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for two nights and everything from the front desk to the rooms to the service were perfect. The lobby is exceptional and the rooms were imaculate. Almost a 5 star experience and an exceptional value for $225 per night in a suite. Will 100% be a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: gregwhite10
Reviews.Content: Totally loved it here. I would stay here every day of my life if I could! It was only one night, but totally amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character in San Fran - would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: keeling_london
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco for 5 nights on business. It's a really warm, atmospheric place with loads of character - I loved the decor, the fact that dogs are allowed to stay, the sitting room with huge fireplace and wine reception every evening, the food in the Grand Cafe, the in-room yoga kit and on-demand yoga channels... the list goes on. The hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin (it's to the southwest of the hotel) which is not the most desirable part of SF, and it's a few blocks from Union Square, but San Fran is easily navigable on foot (or bus or cable car) so it was no problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Save Me, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Goalie858
Reviews.Content: I originally booked the Hotel Monaco because of the location (close to Union Square). We weren't going to have a car on our week trip to San Francisco and this proved to be the PERFECT location. From check in to check out the service and personnel at the hotel were nothing but wonderful. Every person from the front desk people to the concierge, to the cleaning ladies were so helpful and polite. We stayed in a King room with an adjoining living room and the space was more then we expected. The decor in the room was funky and we really loved it. This hotel stood out in our minds for all the little things that they did for us. The first day we were there a knock on the door came and room service was there with a bottle of champagne and two glasses for my fiancee and myself. I am a military member and I am deploying after this trip and they wanted to just wish me well and thank us for spending out last days with them. I couldn't think of anything else to start our trip better. One thing we were really glad about was how good the coffee was. With us being from New England we wouldn't have our Dunkin Donuts for a week but the coffee (free) at the Hotel Monaco was awesome. The water in the lobby infused with lemons, oranges, or cucumbers was also a great touch. Although we never attended, the daily wine socials seemed like a great idea also. Overall, the Hotel Monaco did nothing but make our trip better and better with everything they did. I mean they even called me the night before our departure to make sure we had a way to get to the airport....now that's costumer service. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Ok nothing more”
Reviews.Author: barbara960
Reviews.Content: Overall adequate, nothing more. Very nice staff. Room on the small side. Restaurant expensive.Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience at Hotel Monaco - GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: trademark13
Reviews.Content: My wife and son accompanied me on a business trip to San Francisco. On a previous visit, we had stayed at the Omni (GREAT hotel) near the Financial District, but on this visit we wanted to be a little closer to Union Square. Reading the reviews on Trip Advisor (as I always do) we settled on the Hotel Monaco. It turned out to be a great decision. During our cab ride from the airport, I explained to the driver where we had previously stayed and I asked him about the Hotel Monaco. He said that while, in his opinion, it wasn't quite the Omni, it was indeed a very nice place with a good reputation for service. He did, however, caution us that it was near the edge of the "Tenderloin" section of SF and that we should not venture too far in that direction, particularly at night. This, of course, mirrored several comments that I had seen in several Trip Advisor reviews when talking about the Hotel Monaco's location. In point of fact, however, the location (two blocks off of Union Square in the middle of the Theatre District) turned out to be one of the best things about the hotel. Convenient access to the cable cars, near Union Square, and within walking distance to the Westfield Mall. Knowing that we would be arriving before normal check-in, I had contacted the hotel to make arrangements for an early check-in. Communication was great and I had received an email from the Front Desk Manager assuring me that we could be accommodated. Sure enough, when we arrived (nearly three hours before normal check-in) our room was ready and available to us. Is that fantastic customer service, or what? (Thank you Christine.) The room was clean, smartly decorated, and the beds were very comfortable. The nightly hosted wine hour was a very nice touch. I would recommend obtaining a free Klimpton InTouch Membership before your visit. The membership entitles you to free internet and a number of other worthwhile services. All in all, my family and I thoroughly enjoyed this "boutique" hotel experience. Service, location and class....Hotel Monaco has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, extras made it even more special”
Reviews.Author: gemmom
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for a convention and I tagged along (as I always do when we can get Grandma to come down and watch the kids!) This is the perfect sized hotel -- big enough to offer amenities such as a spa/workout room and a restaurant/bar, but small enough that you don't need 20 minutes and 3 sets of elevators to get to your room. Speaking of which, are clean, cozy and stocked with Aveda shampoo/conditioner. Standard rooms are on the smallish side -- this is San Francisco after all -- and the queen sized bed took a little getting used to, but overall the room was more than adequate. My favorite part of the stay here had to be the evening wine reception with unbelievably delicious (homemade) chocolate truffles and Brian, the very talented (free, but leave a tip!) massage therapist. If I had another week there, I'm sure he could work wonders on my neck and upper back pain! Oliver, the resident golden retriever, was another welcoming employee. Location is great, only a few blocks away from Union Square. I would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samdip
Reviews.Content: Was originally booked in across the road but indifferent staff, and women of questionable repute in the foyer, and a horrible room resulted in an unhappy spouse! So u walked across the road to the Monaco which was the complete opposite. Nice staff nice room clean civilized no hookers! What's not to like more expensve but we did get what we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: djmjr
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Hotel Monaco. As expected in San Francisco, the room was quite small, but it was well appointed. Fitness center was fantastic. Within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, and tons of restaurants and shopping. We took the BART from SFO to the Powell Street station and walked to the hotel. Walked to a Hertz rental garage two blocks down for a day trip to Muir Woods and Sausalito. Staff was friendly, and there's a reception room with Arnold Palmers in the afternoon and a wine reception each evening. Wireless Internet available if you sign up for Kimpton's free rewards program. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nattyw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco at the end of December. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the staff and introduced to all the lobby staff. The girl at the front desk was lovely and offered us tips and advice on things to do, places to eat and gave us a map to find out way around. We stayed on the 5th floor in a queen room. Our room colour was grey striped. I was able to sneak a peak of the green rooms and the green was a little too bright! The room was pretty small but for 2 people it was just enough. The rooms were very clean and i loved the animal print bathrobe! During the evenings from 3-4 they offer you hot chocolate, tea, coffee and brownies in their "lounge room". From 5-6 was the wine reception with free massages on offer. There was also a Wii to play. I thought this was a fabulous little touch after a long day of sightseeing. We got to meet a great variety of people and dogs! The only negative thing about this hotel was the breakfast. I had been traveling around the USA for a while and everywhere I booked there was at least continental breakfast in the offer. To me that meant your basic pastries etc but where you could help yourself. At the Monaco you are unable to help yourself and are given a tiny plain croissant, chocolate croissant and a small bowl of fruit. The wait staff were lovely but the girl ushering us to our seats had a bit of an attitude. I have already booked tickets back and am going to SF again. I am definitely looking to book Monaco again.

Reviews.Title: “Location as it's best”
Reviews.Author: Miracosta
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research and finally decided to stay at Monaco. Upon the check in, Sean didn't give me any option for the update and he didn't look pleasure to meet us. I noticed that Sean wasn't a good guy to talk to when you have requests or questions. (For example:My husband asked Sean what time Starbucks nearby closed and he said 11:30pm. So my husband went at 9:30pm and it was closed. Sean confirmed my husband will qualify for State Employee rate and later reservation agent told us he's not eligible.) Kimpton hotel promises to give us some gift for kids upon check in but there was nothing offered for my kids at Monaco. Bell/Valet service was here and there. It's really up to the person. Sometime it's good sometime is really bad. They didn't even come to open the door when we stopped the car at the front. There was nobody to help us with valet parking. Room was clean and Bed was very comfortable. One complaint was that entrance door has small gap and cold wind coming through the bathroom which makes bathroom super cold at night. We just use this hotel to just "sleep" and location was great. Wallgreens across the street, Starbucks near by. There was water and doggie bone by the front door. Dog lover will love this. I stayed at the 7th floor facing the street but noise wasn't too bad. I heard ambulance and firetruck all the time though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Kimpton Hotel customer, and was excited to stay at the Hotel Monaco...especially after reading the other reviews. However, the hotel seems to be in need of a bit of upkeep as far as cleanliness. I noticed quite a few nicks, dings, and cleaning misses. I can be a bit picky, but I expect my pickiness to be eliminated when staying at a Kimpton Hotel. The location is good, customer service was superb, and I love the clientelel. However, I don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: triplover25
Reviews.Content: This hotel (our second stay) is in a word, amazing. There are so many things about it, but above all, the service and the people that work there are friendly, helpful, and great to deal with at all times. With free wine and massages (you should tip) at wine hour, coffee and tea in the morning, boutique rooms, an amazing location and great guests to connect with, you can't really ask for much more. Well, the yoga kit in the room is great too. Oh and the staff in the Grand Cafe Miguel and Adrian sp.? make the stay even more enjoyable. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - the staff in the Monaco helped make it a trip of a lifetime!!”
Reviews.Author: sengaSQ
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time staying in the Monaco. The staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful. The wine reception every evening and the complimentary continental breakfast every morning added to enjoyment of our 1st visit to San Francisco. It was a joint celebration; our 40th Wedding Anniversary and my sister's partner 50th Birthday and the meal we had in the hotel to celebrate the joint occasion was second to none as was the attention to detail from the staff. Thank you to all the staff and I hope you enjoyed the book about Edinburgh as much as we enjoyed all the interesting reading materials in the lounge. We will definately be back to this hotel and will certainly use the Kimpton chain if visiting anywhere else in America.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: SaltLakeCityUpmann
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is exceptional- the location, room quality, and personable service. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay as memorable as possible. It is the only hotel that I will stay at when in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny San Francisco..”
Reviews.Author: flatworm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in Dec 2010 to see the great Leonard Cohen in concert in Oakland The Monaco is an excellent hotel! Their warm and friendly welcome was much appreciated when I arrived late after a long journey from Hawaii Room spacious and extremely comfortable , slept extremely well , speedy web access for free Didnt eat at restaurant so not able to review The Monaco was not cheap - but SF was busy with a big IT convention so demand was high Couldnt ask for a better location a few minutes stroll from Union Square - you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruth1012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco over Christmas for 6 nights. It is really well located for Union Square and the surrounding areas, it was extremely clean and comfortable, with quirky and fun decor in the main reception rooms. The staff were all polite, friendly and efficient, and the room I had was comfortable, well serviced and well equipped. The doggy visitors were well-behaved (especially Oliver) and the evening hosted wine event was an opportunity to meet and chat to other guests. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: katia_2227
Reviews.Content: We ' ve stayed at the hotel for 5 days. It was just what we needed, well decorated and clean rooms, very friendly staff, excelent city center location and good prices. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BHShahryar
Reviews.Content: we had a very nice time at a fabulous hotel, we were upgraded to a suite upon arrival with a living room, huge for my experience in SanFrancisco, best thing was that we got the parking included rate which was essential, Bed was comfortable with great linens....,my first experience with Kimpton's which will definitely be my first choice when booking future stays

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireCat_m
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, lovely decor and atmosphere A warm welcome at the front desk and staff really polite and friendly. The room was of OK size, there were two queen beds for 3 people so it was a little cramped but it was clean and was fine for what we needed. Loved the free wine and massage you get in the lounge, especially after a long day shopping, carrying heavy bags! The hotel was in great location, near Union Sq and close to shops, theatres etc. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly and Boutique-style elegant/charming”
Reviews.Author: LKayD
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in San Francisco. The location is convenient to theaters and Union Square shopping. The staff is responsive and super-friendly. I love the free wine hour by the fireplace in the lobby, with free back massages (although we tip). You can chat with fellow guests who are visiting from faraway places, which is always interesting. Our dog is welcomed at wine hour, and all through his stay. Service is important here, so just ask if you need something. The spa has a jetted soaking pool with a nice changing room, and other free spa amenities like a sauna. Be ready for cozy-sized rooms, all beautifully decorated. The décor throughout is wonderfully classy yet a bit whimsical. It is a true boutique hotel, with the intimacy that brings. The on-site restaurant is good; we like their breakfast. The doorman service is helpful. I hope you enjoy your visit!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent personalized Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aacana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hotel Monaco in San Francisco for the past 5 years. The hotel is situated within a 5 minute walk to a number of unique restaurants and boutiques. The Monaco is consistent with their first rate service and unbelieveable personalization of the guest profile. The attention to detail is what sets Kimpton (far) apart from other hotels. Not sure where they conduct their "secret training", but I have to say I have never seen anything like this at any other hotel chain. Maybe it's because Kimpton doesn't feel like a chain, but more of a "home away from home". I arrive and the personalized services are already in place. This week a basket of fresh fruit and a box of Raisin Bran were waiting for me upon arival (just add milk, LOL). Every day at 5pm....free wine for hotel guests:-) Kimpton for life....no way another hotel can match the personalized service....

Reviews.Title: “Stylish dog-friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ejs0202
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco provided us great service and recommendations on places to go in the area to experience San Francisco in a short amount of time. Their restaurant is colorful and trendy without being garish, and their location is perfect. I highly recommend Hotel Monaco, especially to vacationers passing through the area who expect the best.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place for business”
Reviews.Author: cke_wa
Reviews.Content: Our group stays at top hotels throughout the country each year and Hotel Monaco is among the best out there. We were in the conference rooms, dined there, and obviously stayed there, so we were able to get a great feel for the service and comfortability. Not only were our conference rooms and meals prepared exactly as we asked and on time, but the staff was incredibly gracious and helpful during the stay. We would absolutley recommend this hotel, especially to those in groups because their amenities make everything so much easier and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Worth trying”
Reviews.Author: Popect
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days and really enjoyed the hotel. As a business traveler that like to enjoy fine things this place was a surprise. A bit older but you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky dog loving hotel.”
Reviews.Author: David26g
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and very animal friendly. The pet register and photo history showed all past animal quests. Service was great and rooms were clean. Locale is walking distance to union square and all the shopping. Hotel offered alot of services and was helpful in our search for things to do in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and fun!”
Reviews.Author: mustang beau
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days just after Thanksgiving and had a lovely time. Our room was an average size, but adequate with fairly good storage space. Everything was very clean and kept that way throughout our stay. Very comfortable beds with high quality pillows and duvets. The decor throughout the hotel is very "camp/kitsch" and a bit over the top for my taste, but still better than generic bland hotel decor in muted neutrals! Each evening there is a free wine happy hour-a nice touch. Even better was the free coffee in the lobby from 5-10 every morning! Location is good, just two blocks from Union Square. I'd stay there again, despite the fact that the front desk staff are very young and pretty clueless about most things!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best small hotels in SFO”
Reviews.Author: razzberry
Reviews.Content: I have tried quite a few small, boutique hotels in SFO over the past 6 years and two years ago stayed here at the Monaco; now I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The staff, no matter what their job, are friendly, helpful and just plain nice. I have been by myself when I have stayed here and I always feel very well taken care of. I love that it is a pet friendly place as are all Kimptons, too. Last summer when it was hot in the city, there was a bottomless pitcher of Sangria available during the evening wine reception. What could be better?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DMCarlson
Reviews.Content: I was familiar with Kimpton properties so decided to try Hotel Monaco in San Francisco. I chose it for its proximity to restaurants and shopping but also as a little getaway. It was wonderful. The staff was pleasant and extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. Our room was cozy. The wine tasting in the living room was fun. The restaurant next door had a fabulous brunch as well as night life with live music. I would have loved to try the spa if we had had more time. Overall, this was a short romantic stop at the end of a business trip but I would visit the Hotel Monaco again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SeattleBee
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the good TripAdvisor reviews, and I am so glad I stayed here. I can only repeat the superlatives expressed by others. Great service, beautiful lobby, good restaurant, good location, and the most comfortable bed ever. The decor of the guest rooms is not my taste...too many contrasting colors and patterns...very busy. But everything else was so perfect that I just decided to learn to like green striped wallpaper.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had a more pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Charlajmg
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for my husband's birthday and the friends who joined us were the ones who recommended Hotel Monaco. They travel to San Francisco fairly regulary and have stayed at a number of places, but had been recommended Hotel Monaco. The staff, accommodations and facility could not have been better! Atmosphere is wonderfully "homey" and the rooms were beautiful and sparkling clean. Staff is beyond accommodating and even helped with the surprise bithday party. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but did take advantage of the business center, spa, bar, various sitting areas and wine-tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Always welcome at this gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaxmanSA
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular at the SF Monaco for the past 4 years and the quality of service, incredible attention to detail, staff efficiency and available facilities never ceases to amaze and impress. The rooms are extremely tastefully furnished, decorated and comfortably equipped. The Grand Cafe (and the Grand Cafe Bar) provide delightful (extremely well priced) food in a great atmosphere. This hotel will certainly encourage you to return to San Francisco - it is truly wonderful. Very well done and thank you again to ALL staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and close to lots of shopping.”
Reviews.Author: cotton94
Reviews.Content: My friend and i really enjoyed staying at the Hotel Monaco. The staff was very friendly and rooms was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the not the best choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: travelfan725
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Monaco. On the one hand, its rooms are fine if not spectacular and its location near Union Station is good. On the other hand, San Francisco has many wonderful hotels, hotels with really spectacular views, hotels with truly outstanding rooms, hotels with superior service and factlities. The Monaco has none of these. The rooms while clean, are small. I found the furnishings overly quirky and fussy, furnishings that might appeal to my eccentric aunt, but not to a modern traveler looking for stylish accomodations. The hotel is located in an older and undistinguished renovated seven story building on a busy street with no views. I highlight the lack of views because San Francisco is a beautiful city with many hills - one of the great charms of staying in this city is to have a room with a view of the skyline or the bay. The Monaco might be a good choice for a small city like Charleston or Savannah for one who seeks deliberately old fashioned accomodations. But it seems to be out of place in San Francisco. I am surprised the hotel is rated so highly on TripAdvisor - there are many better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: tarap_21
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco had excellent service, very hip and swanky rooms and had large conference rooms and provided very tasty food for our Customers. Everyone enjoyed the stay and it is in a GREAT location just a few blocks from Union Square and all of the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fractalactic
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise! Great service, lovely big room (we had a King Deluxe room) with a fabulously comfortable bed. The whole hotel has gone for retro art deco look which makes it feel like less of a chain and a little more like a boutique hotel. It is within easy walking distance of Union Square and Chinatown. If you are a bit more ambitious (as we were) you can even walk all the way to Fisherman's Wharf! The rooms at the hotel have all the amenities: iron and board, hairdryer, honour bar, big TV (if that's your thing on holiday.....we never turned it on as the is too much to see!) and very nice Aveda toiletries. They even give you some funky animal print robes and silly slipper-socks (not to take home, though!). We really enjoyed our stay at the Monaco and would definitely stay there again (or another Kimpton) Only negatives: Parking is pretty expensive if you have hired a car.....$49 per night! And when we called their reservation line, the agent tried to sell us the most expensive room! When we said we were interested in one of the cheaper rooms, she said there were none available, but in fact we were on the website while we were calling and could book the room we wanted right there and then online......what was that all about?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Experience”
Reviews.Author: technosavvy
Reviews.Content: It was a weekend for me and my daughter to enjoy the Bay Area. Our room was cozy, but boutique rooms generally are. Since I booked direct I didn't get a bargain rate as I have in the past on Kimpton stays, but it was worth it this time. The staff were super accommodating and gracious. It was a hit for my grown daughter because she is a devout animal lover and when she saw the dog bowl outside welcoming the pets by name, she wanted to stay longer. Nice to have complimentary internet since both of us are very "wired" with our respective jobs and other family members. No complaints really except I can always use more fluffy pillows. Having the NY Times available to read in the mornings with coffee and/or tea in a quiet refined environment made it wonderful for me. I highly recommend the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Share the Best Experience in San Francisco Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sanirita
Reviews.Content: I just want to share my experience for my trip to San Francisco. It was really a wonderful trip I had to San Francisco. It was my 3rd business visit to San Francisco in California and as usual it was one of the best trip out of my 2 earlier trips. I took my flights from LAX to SFO on September, 9, 2010. I book my flight from Expedia and it was a nice deal I had from them. I had to look for the hotels as well that I actually did not find good on expedia, so I google and found hotels2stay.net and I got the best hotel rates for San Francisco and I quickly book my hotel room as it was discount going on on 3rd night. It was a free night if I stay for 2 nights, I get the 3rd night free of cost. So It was really good and I got my flight and hotel done. Thanks to expedia and hotels2stay.net for the best flight and hotel deal. When I reached my hotel in San Francisco (Hotel Monaco San Francisco - a Kimpton Hotel) I realized that I have lost my hotel booking print out at my desk in Los Angeles. It was embarrassing moment for me, but fortunately I had my notebook with me where I had just login to my email account and took another print out of the hotel booking confirmation that I had received from hotels2stay. And everything was again on track. I had been transferred to my deluxe king room with everything in the room. Fabulous hotel room it was. My room was nicely decorated and comfortable bedding was there. Walls were well painted and covering with wall paper. I did enjoy complimentary wine at 5 O Clock nightly in the lounge downstairs. It was my 2 business meeting back to back 2 days so I get up early and Next day my meeting has been fixed with client on the phone. I left early to my meeting and came back in 3 to 4 hours. Now I had time to enjoy the hotel luxury. I was really excited with the kind of facilities they have in the room. I enjoy minibar and video game a lot, as Love these 2 things. I enjoy free surfing of the internet free of cost at it is available in the entire hotel and there is no charge for this. In the night I had my dinner in Grand Café and went to sleep around 11PM. Next 2 days just vanished with the client meeting and I did not get much time to be there in the hotel but the 1st and 2nd day I really enjoy being there. I check out from the hotel on 12th of September and I was really experience to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Good San Francisco Experience”
Reviews.Author: Flash98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Monaco with our 9 year old daughter. I had visited San Francisco several times over the years, always stating at Fishermans Wharf. A friend recommended staying around Union Square and it was a far more convenient location for shopping, dining and getting a general feel for the city. The hotel itself was great - rooms are small but with a quirky decoration. This is not a sanitised large hotel chain experience, but an old art deco hotel which has been thoughfully restored and which has a real character. The service is very good. We took advantage of the afternoon wine tasting which was friendly and enjoyable. The concierge staff were very helpful with restaurant recommendations. The only downside was a slow and expensive breadkfast in the hotel restaurant on the Saturday morning. Overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Always a fan of the Kimpton Hotel and this location does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: travelhg
Reviews.Content: Always a fan of the Kimpton hotel chain and this location does not disappoint. Located in the Union Sqaure area of town it is perfectly situated to access, by foot, the varied attractions the town has to offer. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean and modern, complete with the signature Kimpton plush animal print robes. Oliver, the dog who greets you at the reception desk was a nice touch to make you feel at home. Though other reviewers mentioned noise, we did not experience any issues with the noise level and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled a long time dream in this visit”
Reviews.Author: sukicamry
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right central in Union Square . Wine tasting each evening in the very cozy living room .. coffee each morning in same living room, with a very warm and friendly fire place. The rooms were not large but not tiny like it would be in NYC. A fully functioning gym very clean. The only shortfall would be lack of drawer space. Otherwise I have not one complaint. Door men always ready to grab you a cab... the desk help printed out my boarding passes for my flight. Always fresh lemon, orange or cucumber water in the lobby at all times. You can't go wrong with the Hotel Monaco

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!! But very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: scubadude83
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Monaco in SF. The staff at check-in was so friendly and accomodating. The decor of this hotel, and any other Kimpton is really nice, and elegant. The rooms were exceptionally clean, and well taken care of. My only slight complaint I have about this hotel was how thin the walls were. You could hear the whole conversation going on in the room next to us. They were talking at a normal voice level, yet could still hear every word. Luckily they weren't rowdy and went to bed about the same time we did. Otherwise I highly highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “.. like being with good friends in a very special place”
Reviews.Author: Lyn014
Reviews.Content: Efficient, professional, friendly, understated elegance in a great location. The hotel is just the right size, not too big...not too small. All amenities designed to pamper, from the room amenities and decor, the inviting,elegant lobby, and especially the "living room" where guests can enjoy very early morning coffee/tea in quiet, well-appointed surroudings, with a big fire place (this was my favorite part of the day). Happy hour in the afternoon. My first stay, but I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon- Great service and free upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: marycanthony
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is a great place to stay for leisure. My husband and I went on our honeymoon and the hotel went above and beyond to keep us happy. We arrived early and went for a walk to lunch at Yank Sing and when we came back there was champagne and chocolate strawberries in our free upgraded suite which was very roomy and comfortable. They had great recommendations on how and when to go to restaurants and shows and also how to continue the rest of our vacation in Napa and how to get back to San Fran. The wine hour was great too and the hotel dog was just precious. Incredible decor on top of that. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful well located hotel minutes away...”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: Beautiful well located hotel minutes away from everything DT SF has to offer. Hotel has well decorated rooms, american size comfort, and friendly professional. Hotel gym is decent with new up to date Precor equipment. One of the nicest hotels I have stayed at, ashame it was for business.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: njdevsfan
Reviews.Content: The staff is welcoming & helpful especially Tim who greets you with a smile, has suggestions for dinner & makes sure you know how to get "home". The location is perfect to get everywhere you need to go in the downtown area including the cable cars which take you all over the city. The restaurant is top notch and the wine hour is a nice treat in the early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryhome
Reviews.Content: Great location in Union Sq. Staff very helpful with directions, theatre tickets, transportation.... Rooms small but cute - interesting decore. Had a massage in the spa; good; nice whirlpool. Enjoyed visit with hotel pet each night in the "living room" including wine! Nice touch. Must see: Wicked (theatre)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: erjh3502
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monaco for 2 nights in September and it was a wonderful stay. We had been to San Francisco twice before but had stayed elsewhere. After researching on Tripadvisor I decided to give Hotel Monaco a try. We were not disappointed. Upon checkon we were upgraded to a junior suite which was very spacious. The staff was extremely accommodating in every regard. The decor was beautiful and the history of the hotel fascinating. It is on a busy street corner so be sure and bring earplugs and/ or travel noise machine if you are a light sleeper. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect anniversary weekend at a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ronmunman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Monaco as a surprise for 11th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival, the front desk upgraded our room to a larger suite without a request. Room was beautiful and quaint. The service level at the hotel was perfect. We had massages in the spa together. dinner that evening and a drink in the bar. Pricing on the room was 1/4 of what we spend in NY. Beds were of Four Seasons qulaity. Couldn't have been a better wedding celebration. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great Kimpton experience”
Reviews.Author: NancyNina
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a lot and always try to stay in Kimptons -- this was my first time at the Monaco though I have stayed at the Monacos in Denver and Chicago, and found them terrific too. (In Denver, I got an upgrade for hula-hooping in the lobby!) As a woman traveling alone I do appreciate the attention to detail and the warm welcome. All my requests were filled immediately -- from a pot of hot water for tea to a yoga mat to a rushed room service breakfast when I had very little time. And the chair massage in the lobby during wine hour was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Yippee - my new fave hotel in SF - I liked it more than the Drisco, which is saying a lot!”
Reviews.Author: xtacine
Reviews.Content: The Monaco - YES. It's ALL GOOD. Our room wasn't that large but it was extremely efficient. The decor is really elegantly cheerful, if there is such a thing, plus the general vibe of the hotel and staff is one of charming efficiency [another oxymoron maybe?] This hotel has BRAINS and BEAUTY all rolled into one. Loved the robes - actually purchased one on-line. Used the fitness center which was packed in the early morning, but cleared out after 8:30am. Enjoyed the bed, enjoyed the breakfast, enjoyed the smallish "scene" during the complimentary wine happy hour downstairs in the lobby. All the while, I got the feeling that the hotel really cares about its guests, right down to the super wireless connection. Yes, I'll stay here again - and I'll recommend it to anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced. Didn't seem like 4 star quality.”
Reviews.Author: erinkkg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but not luxurious by any means. For the price of over $300 a night I expected more. Here's my breakdown: Pros: Good location right by Union Square (The Clift Hotel is next door, Westin St. Francis is close across the street.) Coffee bar in the lobby in the morning Small rooms, but the do have a safe Cool lobby with enormous fireplace Cons: The rooms need to be updated if it's going to stay a four star hotel. They cheaped out by providing Aveda shampoo and conditioner, but not Aveda lotion. There are very few rooms with a view. Ours looked out onto a fire escape. Also, the bellman at the hotel apparently charge the cab drivers $5 under the table for pickups (according to our taxi driver.) If you need a limo/cab find one on your own as they are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: pooTallahassee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Francisco and had a wonderful stay at this Hotel. True perfection throughout from check -in until departure and a great location to walk. Hats off to them.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST in the Heart of the City! The sleep like a baby - the beds are to die for”
Reviews.Author: Gidyup2
Reviews.Content: Im in San Franscisco about once a month for business and enjoy a close walk to work plus easy access to the city. And of course a great night sleep. This property is near Union Square, cable cars to the Wharf, and great restaurants(love Colibri, try it, no disappointments especially if you are a Tequila aficionado). The rooms are stylish, warm and welcoming, service is great and staff very professional. The rooms keep me coming back to any Kimption property because the beds are so amazingly comfortable you cant help but sleep well. I always have a great experience here as well as most Kimpton hotels. Thanks for another great week!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by this hotel as soon as we walked in - the high ceilings and fancy decor make it very striking. The receptionist staff are very helpful, although we were very disappointed that, despite booking (and paying in full) months in advance, we were evidently not 'guaranteed' a room on arrival and potentially faced being transferred somewhere else. Luckily, we got one of the last rooms, but found it ludicrous that our stay there centred around our flight being on time. The room was excellent, despite our initial concerns on arrival. The room was very well appointed and big. The free wine offered to guests between 5-6pm every day was great too! Other minor disappointments were thin windows meaning a lot of road noise (even through the night as the hotel is a stone's throw from Union Square) and no tea/coffee making facilities in any of the rooms (justified from management by their daily morning provision of free coffee in the lobby). Despite this, a very good quality hotel - just be wary of its dubious 'first come first served' room allocation policy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but wonderful staff and an exciting location”
Reviews.Author: Waxy_Dan
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is just an expensive city and there it is. In most other cities, given the size of the room and, what I consider penny-pinching features (e.g. charging for a bottle of water and internet access), I'd probably give a lower rating. But... the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room is comfortable and quiet (very quiet, given the location). For a couple of nights staying in Downtown and seeing everything that has to offer - I'd definitely recommend staying here and getting breakfast in Sear's around the corner. Do some shopping. See some roof gardens. Go to the SF MOMA.... and then stay somewhere different and see a different side to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully exceptional in every way!”
Reviews.Author: PWC5070
Reviews.Content: I just enjoyed a three-night stay at SF's Hotel Monaco. The attractive hotel is well located just off Union Square and within walking distance of many shops and restaurants, as well as a cable car line, yet it still is quiet at night. The building, funishings and employees are wonderfully exceptional in every way! Both public areas and rooms are furnished in a pleasing style that shows no signs of wear; employees are friendly, polite and helpful; the entire facility is pristine and clean and the beds very comfortable. The room's bath was spotlessly clean. Too, there was the additional bonus of a help-yourself coffee, tea and cocoa bar, as well as the 5 pm gratis wine & hors d'oeuvres. Super stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent One Day Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCouple763
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for one night on our way back from Napa Valley and on our way home to Toronto. We arrived before noon, expecting we couldn't check in, but not only was a room available, we were upgraded at no cost at the front desk. Room 601 was perfect for us, quiet, with a king size bed and small sitting room. Bathroom facilities were roomy and functional. We had to return a rental car (which they let us park in front of the hotel while we checked in) and the staff was very helpful in finding us a gas station to fill up and a route to the car rental return! The hotel's location is a couple of blocks off Union Square (lots of shopping) and the Powell Street trolley cars which take you to Fisherman's Wharf and back. We spend the day walking around San Francisco before returning to the hotel around 6 p.m. and asking for a recommendation for dinner. Instead of recommending the hotel's restaurant first, the concierge recommended Fino's, a cozy Italian restaurant a block and a half from the hotel. The food was authentic and the wine list reasonable - we'd return there in a heartbeat! We had to catch a cab to the airport before 6 a.m. the next morning, so it was nice to have a quiet room to sleep in. The checkout was efficient and a cab was waiting for us when we walked out the door. All in all, a short stay, but a memorable one. We would definitely recommend this hotel for friends staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive but slightly overpriced hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hil_W_McD
Reviews.Content: Liked: Fabulous location with all the shops and restaurants of downtown SF within a couple of blocks, genuinely warm, friendly & helpful front desk staff, comfortable clean room, free drink vouchers for the hotel bar, having a hotel dog (or Director of Pet Relations, to give him his full title!) Not so fond of: $10 charge for wifi. A hotel of this calibre and price range should really not be charging for wifi access when its free in most cafes and even some public places these days. Room was on the small side, although nicely decorated. Not brilliant value for money, you're paying extra for the location more than anything else

Reviews.Title: “Clean, charming hotel near the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: MaxRussell
Reviews.Content: We lucked out in ending up at the Hotel Monaco. We almost always use Hotwire to book our hotels when we travel, and we generally like the results. The Monaco was no exception. The location is great if you're looking to be close to it all. It's a couple blocks from the heart of Union Square and a short walk to the Powell St. BART station. There is a lot of activity at night - theatres and restaurants are open nearby - and there are plenty of homeless and intoxicated roaming around but as long as you're streetwise it's no different than any other urban center. The hotel itself is small (200 rooms I believe) and very well maintained. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room on the top floor was small but very clean and well-maintained. We had one king bed and there wasn't room for much else but that's OK, we didn't need much else. The bathroom was very nice as well and the shower was a delight - very powerful! If I had one complaint it's that the TV was an old standard definition box - probably 21" - and I expect a 4-star hotel to have at least a 32" HDTV by this point.

Reviews.Title: “This is the way to stay!”
Reviews.Author: annberg1969
Reviews.Content: Great location, amazing customer service, beautiful decor and great perks! Our first stay with a Kimpton Hotel, usually loyal with Marriott. Will be looking forward to staying at a Kimpton on our next location!

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigdave4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 3 day stay in San francisco. The room was small and quite noisy due to water heating pipes running through room for the rest of the hotel. We had breakfast included in our room price, this was a joke. You could have a small pastry and a bowl of fresh fruit or a slice of toast, not both or you could buy a breakfast from the menu, but it was the service which was shocking. My wife asked for a pot of hot water because the tea was too strong, we waited 35 mins by which time we had finished our breakfast and we left. As we left, i said to the waiter to forget the hot water, he said they were looking for a pot for the water. The next day, we waited 25 mins for our toast and fruit to arrive, when i spoke to the waiter, he said he had lost 3 order slips and ours was one of them. However, the room and hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Jess_Bravo
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at Hotel Monaco. The staff was very nice and accommodating, there was always someone in the front to welcome us or wish us a good day. The room was a bit small, but I was able to adjust, I guess I didn't need much space since we were exploring San Francisco. I really enjoyed their free wine and chair massage at 5pm everyday. It is a special way to say thank you. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: atwoodexplores
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend. We stayed in one of the suites - spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The evening complementary wine and chair massage is a great addition. The fitness center is clean, has about ten machines - mostly treadmills, bikes and ellipticals. Its also a dog-friendly hotel, which was cute. The location is great, central to Union Square, theatre area, cable cars etc...

Reviews.Title: “One of the most incredible, enjoyable stays we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Friscotrip
Reviews.Content: Talk about great customer service. This is the place. From Tim the doorman to Benjie the Bellman, and all of the wonderful people behind the counter-the Hotel Monaco in San Francisco has it all. And they have taken the term "pet-friendly" to new heights. Our Golden fell in love with Oliver, the Golden Retreiver lobby dog. Oliver and his mom Linda were so nice. We looked forward to seeing them every evening during the wine reception hour. It's very rare when you can go to an top notch hotel and be able to bring your dog with you. She was treated as royally as we were. The room was perfect-stylish, spacious, and the bed was awesome. Slept like a baby every night! Being close to Union Square made it even more enjoyable. We were able to walk everywhere to see the sights. The Grand Cafe at the hotel was fantastic too. Great food. The bar was very nice. Friendly bartenders and very good food there too. The entire experiece there was a perfect start to our vacation. We look forward to going back there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations & then some.”
Reviews.Author: Cedarhill4060
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in this stylish hotel just off Union Sq. Service and facilities were mostly excellent from the moment we pulled up at the curb until the morning we left. We got the "stay & park" package so we could not worry about the car. Staff were consistently friendly and helpful. I mentioned to the doorman that the bed was a little soft for me and that night found that they had put a panel under the mattress to firm it up - without being asked. We took full advantage of the morning room with coffee and newspapers (some juice too would have been appreciated). The restaurant (French bistro) and bar (jazz at night) were both comfortable and served excellent and varied food. Only desire would be for queen beds instead of doubles - but we made do. Not a cheap place (but what is in San Fran) but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Stylish, Civilised, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: UKPetey
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Monaco and I'd stay there again if I revisit San Francisco. My favourite things about the hotel are the attentiveness of staff, cleanliness, location, free Wifi, Wine hour/reception, and the great restaurant / bar (Grand Cafe) inside the hotel. As with most hotels there isn't an included breakfast but there are plenty of places just along Geary as you head towards Union Square. They're all similar priced, and for just two people we had to spend between $20 and $30 for sit down breakfast which is not great if you're travelling for a whole month and on a budget like us. We thought the room was great. Bed was very comfy. I would agree with some that the room was smaller than other rooms we have stayed in, but not too small. Our cases fitted around the bed fine, and the bathroom was fine. The decor was kind of chic , and we had to chuckle when we saw the bath robes. Generally we had a great nights sleep here. Location is very convenient with Union square just 2 blocks east, and you're only a few blocks from BART, Muni and cable car stations. There also a Wallgreens opposite the hotel on Geary which we used to buy bottled water (and avoiding paying $5 each for the ones in the hotel room). The hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin area, but its in a busy area so we felt safe walking along the street at night. I guess my advice is don't walk west and you'll be fine. As for homeless people, you will find them on practically every street corner in san francisco, but most seem to be polite and leave you alone. The Grand Cafe was wonderful to have inside the hotel. It is definitely grand, very stylish and relaxing, and has some attentive staff making wonderful cocktails, serving oysters and other great food. We particularly approved of their happy hour! The hotel staff were very helpful. We had a lot of luggage and the door men and bell service were great. They had all of our bags brought from the cab to our room whilst we got settled. On checkout they let us leave our bags whilst we picked up our hire car. When we came back with the car we waited outside whilst they brought the luggage out and helped load it all into the trunk for us! I was very pleased. The only minor problem with our stay was that our room key-cards deactivated on two occasions, once on the day of check-in and once on our third day. Both the room porter and the lady at the reception gave us the same explanation saying to keep the keys away from any electronic devices, however I explained that we did and this happened simultaneously on both cards on both occasions. I suspect a computer fault or manual error on their system. Hopefully they'll get this sorted out in future.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS hotel -- outstanding staff, rooms, amenities -- all around fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KVincent
Reviews.Content: I commute weekly from LA to SF and the Hotel Monaco is truly my home away from home. The rooms are comfy and the staff are phenomenal. The food is also pretty fabulous - I highly recommend the Monaco SF -- love it!

Reviews.Title: “Best service, great location, beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: everestbl00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and loved the place! The coffee in the morning and wine hour in the afternoon are definite pluses. I have traveled all over the world and have to say that this was one of the best valued places I have ever stayed. The location was perfect and walking distance to many attractions. We will stay here every time we come back to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Service is par with any 5*****!”
Reviews.Author: wackywife
Reviews.Content: Checking in into the Monaco we right away had a few problems, internet didn't work in our room, minor plumbing problem et... However, the way the issues were handled were great. They handled them with a smile and very quickly. The lobby is charming, very Morracan like with big windows out to the street, a great place to people watch. The evening wine reception was great, they even offered free chair massages. The location is perfect you can walk almost everywhere and are minutes to the closest trolley stop. Would highly recommend and this will be our San Francisco hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent restaurant, great location”
Reviews.Author: twistfry
Reviews.Content: Suggested by my son who lives in the bay area. Good location for theatres. Food was excellent, wine too. Wine served in the afternoon in lobby. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ethicsjd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for a conference and were impressed with the professionalism and helpfulness of the staff. The banquet manager was incredible - she even started serving meals at one lunch to expedite service and handled all of our last minute conference requests without a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - need better elevators!”
Reviews.Author: katboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to move in daughter at San Francisco State. Centrally located, can walk to Chinatown, a real long walk to north beach, but I did it with my kid to get pizza. Breakfast at the hotel is great, breakfast at the deli across the street is TERRIBLE. Parking will run you an additional $42 to $45 per night

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: tonymsrad
Reviews.Content: A year ago, when I had all San Francisco to choose from, i picked this hotel and loved it. This year my husband had a meeting at the Hyatt, where we did not want to stay. Stupidly I wasted two entire days looking for the perfect hotel, and again I came up with Hotel Monaco . The hotel is gorgeous. The location is perfect . The staff is friendly and helpful. It is a superlative property. Free wifi, which I think is essential. Refreshments in lounge all day, from coffee and tea all morning to tea and lemonade all afternoon, to wine and sangria from 5 to 6.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. We stayed in the Mediterranean Suite and it was perfect for me and my teenage daughter. As an interior designer, I can say the interior was amazingly refreshing from what I'm used to seeing in other hotels. Basically, if you book at a Kimpton Hotel, you can't go wrong. Get the fish in your room, it's their signature perk, and if traveling with kids or teens, it's a must. Also, don't forget you can travel with your own pet at Kimpton Hotels, and they welcome Fido. Literally, with a welcome sign in the lobby and a bowl, etc. Great customer service whether you have two legs or four.

Reviews.Title: “the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: BOZENA21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, clean with very relaxing atmosphere! Staff was very polite and would go out of their way to help us out. Location was perfect as trasportation, shopping, eatting is all within 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in good location”
Reviews.Author: kittycats02
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of it's location and because we really like Kimpton hotels. You are in the heart of San Francisco, 2 short blocks away from Union Square, trolley cars, Bart, and Muni. We stayed in a suite which was on the smallish side but if you've ever been to San Francisco you know that all hotel rooms in the City have small rooms. The staff at this hotel are genuinely nice and extremely helpful. The bellhops recommended good places for dinner and breakfast. Tip: If you are unable to make the wine hour (which is great) go to the front desk and they will give you a voucher for a drink at the bar for any time of your choosing. If you need to park a car, I would not recommend the valet service. We didn't use it but you can park right around the corner at the same garage the hotel uses for $30 a day including taxes.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lilac5
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Hotel Monaco and were extremely pleased with our experience. Lovely room, very clean, great location and everyone was so friendly and helpful. I would like to thank Mary and Christine for their helpfulness and kindness, you are awesome. We ate at the attached restaurant (Grand Cafe) and were very pleased. The food was excellent and the staff was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There wasn't anything we didn't like about the Monaco!!!”
Reviews.Author: DocHoc
Reviews.Content: From the warm greeting upon our arrival (and the early check-in!), to the nicely appointed rooms (with good product!) to the afternoon wine and snacks (and complimentary massage if you signed-up early enough!), to the helpful doorman (who got us taxis and gave directions and "the local's" restaurant recommendations.....we had a fantastic long weekend, made all the better by the great accommodations at the Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful jewel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: gpmelcher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Monaco for business several times a year for the past 4 years, and every time I feel like I am on vacation! Their staff remember my name even though I only come twice a year. The staff bend over backwards to meet your requests, and the rooms are very comfortable with numerous amenities such as DVD player, iPod station radio, robes, etc. One of my favorite things is the 40's and 50's jazz music that plays 24 hrs a day in the lobby and first floor library-fireplace lounge. The morning coffee and afternoon Arnold Palmer service is definitely a plus, and if you enjoy wine, they serve that in the late afternoon too! The best theaters in San Francisco are right down Geary St, and Union Square is 2 blocks away. Lots of fine dining in the neighborhood, but I feel the Grand Cafe at Hotel Monaco stands up to any of them for price and quality. Do yourself a favor - next time you take a trip - leisure or business - to San Francisco, try out the Hotel Monaco. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - made me feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Julep74
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel using a travel website as an alternative to the big Conference hotel where I was attending a conference. Not only was the Monaco less expensive than the Conference hotel, it was so much nicer, comfortable, and friendly and included more amenities. The staff practically greeted us by name every time we came in to the building. They had a "living room" where you could relax and hang out, including a wine tasting hour (with free chair massage and a Wii to entertain the kids (and adults!)! Rooms were comfortable and well decorated. Everyone was helpful and friendly. I'd definitely stay again next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BonhomieCA
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to host a business dinner / reception at this lovely hotel in June. Not only was the party the talk of the conference (held at a nearby hotel), but the staff were fantastic to work with. A couple of colleagues and I had the pleasure of staying overnight at the Monaco, and were thoroughly impressed. Comfortable, cosy, nicely decorated rooms, great beds, power shower, and top name amenities. They offer wine and hot chocolate to guests in the lobby in the afternoons, and a mini massage if you sign up in time, or there's a full service spa downstairs. Its a fun, pet friendly, colorful hotel. The on-site restaurant, The Grand Cafe, is also fabulous. Couldn't ask for a better meal or friendlier staff. I had to visit several times to set up our event, and was lucky enough to get to taste a number of items on the menu. It all was perfectly cooked and presented. An excellent wine list. The chef made visits to many of the tables, a nice touch. Its a great spot for dinner, even if you don't stay overnight. Their happy hour is well worth a visit, if you're watching your expenses. The hotel is 2 blocks past Union Square, and while its heading towards the seedy Tenderloin district, the Monaco is a warm safe haven of a hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to shopping and tourist action”
Reviews.Author: T02
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at Kimpton property because of it's pet friendly policy. Hotel check-in was hassle free and room was clean with an ample number of electric outlets. Wireless Internet access is free if you are a Kimpton In-touch member. The wine reception is convenient an sometimes they serve hot apps. We were in San Francisco to visit the De Young and decided to use public transportation. No problems at all with that. There is a bus stop across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail and personal service”
Reviews.Author: spiltinky
Reviews.Content: Having visited close to a dozen hotels in near proximity to Hotel Monaco over the years, this was by far our best experience. The staff was exceedingly gracious and helpful, the room was very attractive and the stay included nice touches such as complimentary in-room champagne with personal note upon arrival in acknowledgement of our birthdays and meeting two cute and well-behaved hotel dogs during our stay. We also enjoyed meeting fellow (human) travelers from around the world during the late afternoon wine tasting. Another huge plus was the noise level in our room, which was quiet, even with the window cracked. We will definitely return the next time we're looking for a nice get-away spot in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: perfectred
Reviews.Content: We live close by and decided to celebrate a b'day, and play tourist for 24 hrs. Starting with an afternoon check-in and a complimentary bottle of wine. The room(mini-suite) was funky,charming and extremely comfortable. Loved the outrageous robes!!! Dinner in the Grand Cafe was delicious. Service excellent, and yet another surprise... b'day dessert. Will definately come back, and not wait for a special occasion. The area around the hotel is perfect for walking, shopping, and you're right in the heart of the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: igang
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really enjoyed Monaco while staying there. The room decoration was very cute- not very large but descent size. Bathroom was clean, too. All the staffs were very kind and attentive. They offer free coffee during the morning, lemonaid and ice tea around 2-3pm, and wine(both red & white) from 5-6pm, which was nice. Location was ok- it takes about 5 min walk to Union sq. The only downside of this hotel is that the fitness club opens too late(9am) and closes too early(9pm). Also the breakfast time was quite late(7am). I stayed there 2 nights during the business trip but could not use the fitness club once. But for the leisure trip, I highly recommend Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dspreis
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff and comfortable, nicely appointed rooms. Morning coffee and afternoon wine hour was much appreciated. Area is very convenient to great restaurants, shopping and trolley. Try 'Honey honey' around the corner for breakfast or lunch one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and location great”
Reviews.Author: Savytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience was great. The service was wonderful and very hospitable... Doormen were very imformative! The one always knew both my husbands and my name - very personable service :-). Rooms were clean, however, very busy in design yet FUN. The hotel restaurant was just okay But I must pass on that the Ambr (indian food) was by far the BEST Indian rstaurant I have ever been too!!! The Ambr was close to Union Square - I believe???

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: EllensideaTexas
Reviews.Content: Just a wonderfully managed and maintained hotel. Friendly greetings and faces everywhere. Loved the whimsical decor that brought charm and relaxation into the rooms and the very obvious attention to comfort in the luxurious bedding. The coffee bar in what I referred to as the morning room was so nice. I will stay here every time I return to San Francisco from this point on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Goetmilo
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect to discover SF on feet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nicely decorated. The restaurant decorated in true French brasserie style in the hotel serves excellent food. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel...But Learn From My Mistakes”
Reviews.Author: Humres32
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco was excellent in many ways. The staff were fabulous. The hot and cold coffee bar in the AM was great. They offer lemonade and iced tea in the PM and then from 5pm-6pm there is a free wine happy hour with free massages. Very nice touch. The rooms were decent (started in the king room which was spacious; ended up later in queen room which was definitely smaller but still nice). Both rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Here are my lessons learned. #1 - request a room that is an interior room. You do not want a room that faces either Geary or Taylor. They are very busy roads with lots of traffic, but the worst part is all the action that continues to occur both at night and in the early AM. You will hear them pick up trash on Friday morning (around 6am), you will hear deliveries being made, when the drunk people are leaving the local bar you will hear them yelling, and you will hear the street cleaning in the early AM. We had 2 nights of this and I finally asked to be moved. They were wonderful and accommodated my request, although I had to take a lesser room...it was worth it. My 2nd lesson learned is that I'm not sure if Union Square was the right location for my hotel given my itinerary. We were constantly in a cab going to other areas. Union Square is perfect if you plan to shop, but our plans included biking the Golden Gate Bridge, going to Napa, going to Alcatraz and taking a Taste of Italy walking tour. My comment here is no reflection on the hotel...this is simply a matter of what we were chosing to do. I was in San Fran during the 4th of July weekend and I can tell you Fisherman's Wharf was an absolute mass of humanity. I wouldn't want any part of that area either. I will say the Hotel Monaco was not insane with people during the holiday and I did appreciate that. Again, for you shoppers, if you stay here you are 2 blocks from major shopping. You are also 2 blocks from picking up the cable car. I recommend you start at the very end of the cable car line so that you have a chance to get a decent seat. If you try to pick up the car mid route, you may or may not be able to get on. Given the fact that the start of the line is only a few blocks away, it is definitely worth the short extra walk.

Reviews.Title: “what a fabulous hotel !”
Reviews.Author: foodloverLiverpool
Reviews.Content: hotel monaco is one of the best hotels we have stayed in, the staff cannot do enough for you, the rooms are not big but beautifully decorated and the bed is one of the comfiest we have slept in, the grand cafe is fabulous, the happy hour each day is great , other hotels could learn from the monaco how to treat their guests, thank you for a wonderful stay, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SALLYM42
Reviews.Content: Monaco is an old building that is clean, homely and welcoming, It has individual decor for each room. If you aren't used to sharing your hotel with beds - prepare yourself, but they are entirely non-intrusive and it reminds you how normal life is. The atmosphere is austere and laid back at the same time. If you are a true wine critic, you won't stay long for the wine hour and you are unlikely to return, but who cares really? Enjoy SF, its a fun place to visit. Sleep comfortably in a clean, comfortable and well maintained room at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bsjs25
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have visited San Francisco and we wanted to try a different hotel. We are so glad we did. This hotel has the most helpful and friendliest staff we have encountered in a city hotel. Great location in the union square area. Rooms are very comfortable and very clean. We throughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome !”
Reviews.Author: mdmemvp
Reviews.Content: Loved the wine reception with free massages each night. The staff were profession, helpful and friendly. We had several spa treatments which were great. I loved the Oliver, the dog at the front desk and having a fish to keep us company in our room. The coffee and relaxed atmosphere in the morning was really nice. My 1 complaint is the curtain in our room had a large stain on it and my duvet cover was also stained.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lacemonkey
Reviews.Content: Great check in and welcome, excellent food in the restaurant and the cafe. Loved the decor. The wine reception was a nice touch . The rooms and beds were extremely comfortable and no noise at all at night. Only one criticism would be the awful bathrobes. A terrible brown colour so you can't tell whether they are clean or not and much too rough to wear. The CD player in our room wasn't working and was fixed immediately. The hotel location was good - just a short walk to Union Square. we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel, would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: SglynnIreland
Reviews.Content: What more can I say!? Fantastic room with beautiful bed linen, Aveda bathroom supplies and funky animal print bathrobes. Wonderful restaurant/bar area. Great concierge. Loved the wine hour and the fantastic neck and back massage offered during wine hour. Stayed at the hotel next door and paid more money for a less enjoyable stay. Really loved the decor, staff and overall experience in the Monaco. The front desk even printed my boarding pass for me! If you are in doubt about where to stay in San Fran stay here!

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing stay. Totally in line...”
Reviews.Author: triplover25
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay. Totally in line with all other positive reviews. Wine daily in the hotel for an hour. Just phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: DawsonUK
Reviews.Content: Lets get my little niggles out of the way, no coffee or tea facilities in the room...that was about it. The staff were just excellent, from check in to doorman to waiters and bar staff...just first class. The hotel was very central to Union Square and all transport links. Our room was comfortable and had free wi-fi (Join Kimpton rewards programme to benefit from this). The bathroom was excellent and the free wine in an evening started our nights out lovely. Would definately stay here again...and would always look at Kimpton before any of the bigger chains. I left them feeling like a person and customer unlike the number I was at the Fairmont in San Jose. Breakfast was served in a lovely dining room and continental was included in our rate.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: TJKSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Our group of five was in three separate rooms and we all were very comfortable. We especially loved the living room. Just beyond the elevators, it has a huge fireplace, lovely windows facing the street, and several cozy seating areas. One night we gathered there to share photos on a computer and chat for an hour. Just delightful. The afternoon wine sessions are very convivial and we really appreciated the morning coffee and tea. Nice to sit and read their newspapers or take a cup of coffee to go. The gym was convenient and well outfitted. Great location. Great value. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco vacation”
Reviews.Author: BoSox999
Reviews.Content: Staff are very, very friendly & helpful. Hotel gives easy acess to all parts of the city. Buy the local transportation pass (MUNI PASS). The spa area in hotel have a really good sauna, steam & OK jacuzzi--open for all guests. Can walk to shopping, Chinatown, etc. Don't miss. Started out at Yosemite Nat Park, 4 hours from San Francisco, 2 hours from Fresno, which was beyond my wildest dreams. In San Francisco don't miss the de Young museum and if you have kids the Academy of Sciences is really cool. I spent a week in San Francisco & could of spent another 3 or 4 days there, a lot to do & see. Skip the touristy Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pongowaring
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a trip down the coast. The hotel is beautiful and ideally located for everything. The hotel staff are so kind and helpful- nothing appears to be too much trouble. The rooms are a perfectly good size- They are not huge resort size, but then San Francisco is a city not a beach! I will tell everyione I know to stay here if they come to the lovely San Francisco. We also found the rooms to be quiet- however we did ask for a high room. I think if you are noise sensitive it may be worth requesting a high floor. We also had complimentarycontinental breakfast throughout our stay- juice/ coffee/ fruit and danish. They were quite delicious and totally unexpected. The cafe staff were also fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jippybeale
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from staying at the Monaco, I was quite surprised to see this hotel rated so highly by other travellers. The public areas of this hotel are fantastic, with extremely high ceilings, big fireplaces and just a very classy overall look. The rooms, however, I found absolutely average. Garish lime and lemon stripe wallpaper, which you do get use to, an old 'box' type TV and a cheap bath/shower combi. The bed was comfortable but very short.
